docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Messenger interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods provided and notifications sent.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Messenger JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Messenger interface:

Messenger interface methods:

Method Description join Joins a messaging room leave Leaves a messaging room send Sends a message to a messaging room

docs.title: join <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Joins a messaging room.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: If the specified room does not exist, then it will be created.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.room string Name of the room to join params.user string Name of ther user to join as params?.secure string <sup>(optional)</sup> Denotes if the room is secure (by default not secure) (must be one of the following: insecure, secure) params?.acl array <sup>(optional)</sup> List of URL origins with possible wildcards params?.acl[#] string <sup>(optional)</sup> ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Token for accessing the room (unique for a user)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE User name is already taken (i.e. the user has already joined the room) ERROR_BAD_REQUEST User name or room name is invalid ERROR_PRIVILEGED_REQUEST Room security errors

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Messenger.1.join",
  "params": {
    "room": "Lounge",
    "user": "Bob",
    "secure": "insecure",
    "acl": [
      "..."
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "1e217990dd1cd4f66124"
}

docs.title: leave <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Leaves a messaging room.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The room ID becomes invalid after this call. If there are no more users, the room will be destroyed and related resources freed.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.roomid string Token of the room to leave

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY The room token is invalid

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Messenger.1.leave",
  "params": {
    "roomid": "1e217990dd1cd4f66124"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: send <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Sends a message to a messaging room.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.roomid string Token of the room to send the message to params.message string Contents of the message to send

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY The room token is invalid

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Messenger.1.send",
  "params": {
    "roomid": "1e217990dd1cd4f66124",
    "message": "Hello!"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Messenger interface:

Messenger interface events:

Notification Description roomupdate Notifies of room status changes userupdate Notifies of user status changes message Notifies of messages sent the the room

docs.title: roomupdate <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of room status changes.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Immediately after registering to this notification the listener will sequentially receive updates of all rooms that have been created so far.

If applicable, this notification may be sent out during registration, reflecting the current status.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.room string Name of the room that has changed its status params.action string New room status (must be one of the following: created, destroyed) params.secure string Denotes if the room is secure (must be one of the following: insecure, secure)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Messenger.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "roomupdate",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.roomupdate",
  "params": {
    "room": "Lounge",
    "action": "created",
    "secure": "insecure"
  }
}

docs.title: userupdate <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of user status changes.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Immediately after registering to this notification the listener will sequentially receive updates of all users that have joined the room so far.

If applicable, this notification may be sent out during registration, reflecting the current status.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.user string Name of the user that has changed its status params.action string New user status (must be one of the following: joined, left)

The roomId argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 1e217990dd1cd4f66124.client.userupdate.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Messenger.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "userupdate",
    "id": "1e217990dd1cd4f66124.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "1e217990dd1cd4f66124.client.userupdate",
  "params": {
    "user": "Bob",
    "action": "joined"
  }
}

docs.title: message <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of messages sent the the room.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.user string Name of the user that has sent the message params.message string Contents of the sent message

The roomId argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 1e217990dd1cd4f66124.client.message.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Messenger.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "message",
    "id": "1e217990dd1cd4f66124.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "1e217990dd1cd4f66124.client.message",
  "params": {
    "user": "Bob",
    "message": "Hello!"
  }
}

docs.title: Monitor API
docs.text:
Version: 1.0.0

Status:

Monitor interface for Thunder framework.

(Defined by Monitor.json)

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Methods

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Monitor interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Monitor JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Monitor interface:

Monitor interface methods:

Method Description restartlimits Sets new restart limits for a service resetstats Resets memory and process statistics for a single service watched by the Monitor

docs.title: restartlimits <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Sets new restart limits for a service.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.callsign string The callsign of a service to reset measurements snapshot of params.restart object Restart limits for failures applying to the service params.restart.limit integer Maximum number or restarts to be attempted params.restart.window integer Time period (in seconds) within which failures must happen for the limit to be considered crossed

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Monitor.1.restartlimits",
  "params": {
    "callsign": "WebServer",
    "restart": {
      "limit": 3,
      "window": 60
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: resetstats <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Resets memory and process statistics for a single service watched by the Monitor.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.callsign string The callsign of a service to reset statistics of

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Measurements for the service before reset result.measurements object Measurements for the service result.measurements.resident object Resident memory measurement result.measurements.resident.min integer Minimal value measured result.measurements.resident.max integer Maximal value measured result.measurements.resident.average integer Average of all measurements result.measurements.resident.last integer Last measured value result.measurements.allocated object Allocated memory measurement result.measurements.allocated.min integer Minimal value measured result.measurements.allocated.max integer Maximal value measured result.measurements.allocated.average integer Average of all measurements result.measurements.allocated.last integer Last measured value result.measurements.shared object Shared memory measurement result.measurements.shared.min integer Minimal value measured result.measurements.shared.max integer Maximal value measured result.measurements.shared.average integer Average of all measurements result.measurements.shared.last integer Last measured value result.measurements.process object Processes measurement result.measurements.process.min integer Minimal value measured result.measurements.process.max integer Maximal value measured result.measurements.process.average integer Average of all measurements result.measurements.process.last integer Last measured value result.measurements.operational boolean Whether the service is up and running result.measurements.count integer Number of measurements result.observable string A callsign of the watched service result.restart object Restart limits for failures applying to the service result.restart.limit integer Maximum number or restarts to be attempted result.restart.window integer Time period (in seconds) within which failures must happen for the limit to be considered crossed

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Monitor.1.resetstats",
  "params": {
    "callsign": "WebServer"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "measurements": {
      "resident": {
        "min": 0,
        "max": 100,
        "average": 50,
        "last": 100
      },
      "allocated": {
        "min": 0,
        "max": 100,
        "average": 50,
        "last": 100
      },
      "shared": {
        "min": 0,
        "max": 100,
        "average": 50,
        "last": 100
      },
      "process": {
        "min": 0,
        "max": 100,
        "average": 50,
        "last": 100
      },
      "operational": true,
      "count": 100
    },
    "observable": "callsign",
    "restart": {
      "limit": 3,
      "window": 60
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the Monitor interface:

Monitor interface properties:

Property Description status (read-only) Service statistics

docs.title: status <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the service statistics.

This property is read-only.

The callsign argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Monitor.1.status@<callsign>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description callsign string If omitted then all observed objects will be returned on read

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Service statistics result[#] object ... result[#].measurements object Measurements for the service result[#].measurements.resident object Resident memory measurement result[#].measurements.resident.min integer Minimal value measured result[#].measurements.resident.max integer Maximal value measured result[#].measurements.resident.average integer Average of all measurements result[#].measurements.resident.last integer Last measured value result[#].measurements.allocated object Allocated memory measurement result[#].measurements.allocated.min integer Minimal value measured result[#].measurements.allocated.max integer Maximal value measured result[#].measurements.allocated.average integer Average of all measurements result[#].measurements.allocated.last integer Last measured value result[#].measurements.shared object Shared memory measurement result[#].measurements.shared.min integer Minimal value measured result[#].measurements.shared.max integer Maximal value measured result[#].measurements.shared.average integer Average of all measurements result[#].measurements.shared.last integer Last measured value result[#].measurements.process object Processes measurement result[#].measurements.process.min integer Minimal value measured result[#].measurements.process.max integer Maximal value measured result[#].measurements.process.average integer Average of all measurements result[#].measurements.process.last integer Last measured value result[#].measurements.operational boolean Whether the service is up and running result[#].measurements.count integer Number of measurements result[#].observable string A callsign of the watched service result[#].restart object Restart limits for failures applying to the service result[#].restart.limit integer Maximum number or restarts to be attempted result[#].restart.window integer Time period (in seconds) within which failures must happen for the limit to be considered crossed

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Monitor.1.status@WebServer"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "measurements": {
        "resident": {
          "min": 0,
          "max": 100,
          "average": 50,
          "last": 100
        },
        "allocated": {
          "min": 0,
          "max": 100,
          "average": 50,
          "last": 100
        },
        "shared": {
          "min": 0,
          "max": 100,
          "average": 50,
          "last": 100
        },
        "process": {
          "min": 0,
          "max": 100,
          "average": 50,
          "last": 100
        },
        "operational": true,
        "count": 100
      },
      "observable": "callsign",
      "restart": {
        "limit": 3,
        "window": 60
      }
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Monitor interface:

Monitor interface events:

Notification Description action Signals an action taken by the Monitor

docs.title: action <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals an action taken by the Monitor.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.callsign string Callsign of the service the Monitor acted upon params.action string The action executed by the Monitor on a service. One of: "Activate", "Deactivate", "StoppedRestarting" params.reason string A message describing the reason the action was taken

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Monitor.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "action",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.action",
  "params": {
    "callsign": "WebServer",
    "action": "Deactivate",
    "reason": "EXCEEDED_MEMORY"
  }
}

docs.title: Case Sensitivity

Netflix interface methods:

docs.title: factoryreset <sup>method</sup>
docs.text:
Performs a reset to factory defaults.

factoryreset is an alternative name for this method. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Netflix is unavailable

docs.title: Request
docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Netflix.1.factoryreset"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.text: Sends a system command to Netflix.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.command string Command to send to Netflix

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors

docs.title: Request

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

  "params": {

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.text:

Netflix interface properties:

Property Description esn deprecated (read-only) ESN value visibility deprecated (write-only) Current Netflix visibility

StateControl interface properties:

Property Description state Running state of the service

docs.title: esn <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the ESN value.

This property is read-only.

esn is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string ESN value

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Netflix is unavailable

}

docs.title: visibility <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the current Netflix visibility.

This property is write-only.

visibility is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

Also see: visibilitychange

docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string Current Netflix visibility

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,

  "params": "visible"

    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.text:
Provides access to the running state of the service.

Also see: statechange

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string Running state of the service

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Running state of the service

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Netflix.1.state"
}

docs.title: Get Response

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "resumed"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Netflix.1.state",
  "params": "resumed"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Netflix interface:

Netflix interface events:

Notification Description playbackchange Signals playback status change

StateControl interface events:

Notification Description statechange Signals a state change of the service

docs.title: playbackchange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals playback status change.

docs.title: Parameters

docs.title: Registration

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

  "method": "client.playbackchange",

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.statechange",
  "params": {
    "suspended": false
  }
}

docs.title: Case Sensitivity

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

NetworkControl interface methods:

docs.title: interfaces <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the currently available interfaces.

  "id": 42,

docs.text:
Provides access to the status of requested interface.

The interface argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. NetworkControl.1.status@<interface>.

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

The interface argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. NetworkControl.1.network@<interface>.

docs.text: Name Type Description interface string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Network info of requested interface (property).value array ... (property).value[#] object ... (property).value[#].address string IP Address (property).value[#].defaultgateway string Default Gateway (property).value[#].mask integer Network mask (property).value[#].mode string Mode of interface activation Dynamic or Static (must be one of the following: Dynamic, Static)

  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.network@xyz",

    "value": [

        "address": "...",
        "defaultgateway": "...",
        "mask": 0,
        "mode": "Static"
      }
    ]
  }

    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the NetworkTools interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods provided and notifications sent.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: NetworkTools JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the NetworkTools interface:

NetworkTools interface methods:

Method Description ping Ping the given destination with ICMP packages traceroute TraceRoute to the given destination with ICMP packages

docs.title: ping <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Ping the given destination with ICMP packages.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.destination string The node id of the host we would like to ping (ipv4/ipv6) params.timeoutinseconds integer Time out, continue to ping for the given duration params.count integer Maximum number of pings to send

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_NONE, ERROR_INPROGRES means an icmp check is already in progress .

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkTools.1.ping",
  "params": {
    "destination": "...",
    "timeoutinseconds": 0,
    "count": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_NONE, ERROR_INPROGRES means an icmp check is already in progress

{

  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkTools.1.traceroute",
  "params": {
    "destination": "...",
    "timeoutinseconds": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.source string The NodeId of the system that send the metadta presented in the next field params.metadata string Depending on the tool started, this JSON string will contain additional information on this notification

docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the OCDM interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its properties provided and notifications sent.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: OpenCDMi JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the OCDM interface:

OCDM interface properties:

Property Description drms (read-only) Supported DRM systems keysystems (read-only) DRM key systems sessions (read-only) Active sessions enumerator

docs.title: drms <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the supported DRM systems.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Supported DRM systems result[#] object ... result[#].name string Name of the DRM result[#].keysystems array Key system identifier list result[#].keysystems[#] string Identifier of a key system

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.drms"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "name": "PlayReady",
      "keysystems": [
        "com.microsoft.playready"
      ]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: keysystems <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the DRM key systems.

This property is read-only.

The drm system argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. OCDM.1.keysystems@<drm-system>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description drm-system string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array DRM key systems result[#] string Identifier of a key system

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Invalid DRM name

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.keysystems@PlayReady"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "com.microsoft.playready"
  ]
}

docs.title: sessions <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the active sessions enumerator.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Active sessions enumerator result[#] object ... result[#].drm string Name of the DRM system

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.sessions"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "drm": "PlayReady"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the OCDM interface:

OCDM interface events:

Notification Description drmalreadyinitialized Signals that the specified DRM system could not be initialized because it is already initialized by another process drminitializationstatus Notifies about DRM initialization status

docs.title: drmalreadyinitialized <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals that the specified DRM system could not be initialized because it is already initialized by another process.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When this event is received, the application owning given DRM system should release it immediately.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.drm string Name of the DRM system

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "drmalreadyinitialized",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.drmalreadyinitialized",
  "params": {
    "drm": "PlayReady"
  }
}

docs.title: drminitializationstatus <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies about DRM initialization status.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about DRM retrying status busy/failure/success

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.status string BUSY - drm is used by another process, SUCCESS - recovered from BUSY state after retry, FAILED - not recovered after re-trying from BUSY params.drm string Name of the DRM system

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "drminitializationstatus",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.drminitializationstatus",
  "params": {
    "status": "SUCCESS",
    "drm": "PlayReady"
  }
}

docs.text:

This property is read-only.

dolby_atmosmetadata is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": false
}

docs.text:
Provides access to the sound Mode - Mono/Stereo/Surround.

This property is read-only.

dolby_soundmode is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Sound Mode - Mono/Stereo/Surround (must be one of the following: Dolbydigital, Dolbydigitalplus, Mono, Passthru, SoundmodeAuto, Stereo, Surround, Unknown)

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "Unknown"

This property is write-only.

dolby_enableatmosoutput is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Output.1.dolbyatmosoutput",
  "params": false
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:

    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

dolby_mode is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Output.1.dolbymode"

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "DigitalPcm"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Output.1.dolbymode",
  "params": "DigitalPcm"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.soundmodechanged",

docs.title: install <sup>method</sup>

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PackageManager.1.install",
  "params": {
    "type": "...",
    "id": "...",
    "version": "...",
    "url": "...",
    "appname": "...",
    "category": "..."

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the PackageManager interface:

PackageManager interface events:

Notification Description operationstatus Completion of asynchronous operation

docs.title: operationstatus <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Completion of asynchronous operation.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.handle string Handle of the currently progressing operation (i.e, install/uninstal/download) params.operation string Type of the operation params.type string Type of the package params.id string Id of the package params.version string Version of the package params.status string Current status of the operation params.details string Details about the operation

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PackageManager.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "operationstatus",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.operationstatus",
  "params": {
    "handle": "...",
    "operation": "...",
    "type": "...",
    "id": "...",
    "version": "...",
    "status": "...",
    "details": "..."
  }
}

docs.title: install <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Installs a package given by a name, an URL or a file path.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.package string A name, an URL or a file path of the package to install params?.version string <sup>(optional)</sup> Version of the package to install params?.architecture string <sup>(optional)</sup> Architecture of the package to install

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_INPROGRESS Returned when the function is called while other installation/synchronization is already in progress.

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Packager.1.install",
  "params": {
    "package": "thunder-plugin-netflix",
    "version": "1.0",
    "architecture": "arm"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the PerformanceMonitor interface:

PerformanceMonitor interface properties:

Property Description measurement (read-only) Retrieve the performance measurement against given package size

docs.title: measurement <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the retrieve the performance measurement against given package size. Measurements will be provided in milliseconds.

This property is read-only.

The package size argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. PerformanceMonitor.1.measurement@<package-size>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description package-size string Size of package whose statistics info has to be retrieved

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Retrieve the performance measurement against given package size. Measurements will be provided in milliseconds (property).serialization object Time taken to complete serialization (property).serialization?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).serialization?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).serialization?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).serialization?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).deserialization object Time taken to complete deserialization (property).deserialization?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).deserialization?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).deserialization?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).deserialization?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).execution object Time taken to complete execution (property).execution?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).execution?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).execution?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).execution?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).threadpool object Time taken to complete threadpool wait (property).threadpool?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).threadpool?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).threadpool?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).threadpool?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).communication object Time taken to complete communication (property).communication?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).communication?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).communication?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).communication?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).total object Time taken to complete whole jsonrpc process (property).total?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).total?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).total?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).total?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PerformanceMonitor.1.measurement@1000"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

Method Description deleteKey Deletes a key from the specified namespace deleteNamespace Deletes the specified namespace flushCache Flushes the device cache getKeys Returns the keys that are stored in the specified namespace getNamespaces Returns the namespaces getStorageSizes Returns the size occupied by each namespace getValue Returns the value of a key from the specified namespace setValue Sets the value of a key in the the specified namespace setNamespaceStorageLimit Sets the storage limit for a given namespace getNamespaceStorageLimit Returns the storage limit for a given namespace

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Unknown error

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PersistentStore.1.deleteKey",
  "params": {
    "namespace": "ns1",
    "key": "key1",
    "scope": "device"
  }
}

docs.title: Response

  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "storageList": [
      {
        "namespace": "ns1",
        "size": 100
      }
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: getValue <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Returns the value of a key from the specified namespace.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.namespace string Namespace params.key string Key params?.scope string <sup>(optional)</sup> Scope (default: device)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result.value string Value result.success boolean Legacy parameter (always true) (default: True) result?.ttl integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Time in seconds

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_PENDING_CONDITIONS Time is not synced ERROR_NOT_EXIST Unknown namespace ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown key ERROR_GENERAL Unknown error

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PersistentStore.1.getValue",
  "params": {
    "namespace": "ns1",
    "key": "key1",
    "scope": "device"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "value": "value1",
    "success": true,
    "ttl": 100
  }
}

docs.title: setValue <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Sets the value of a key in the the specified namespace.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.namespace string Namespace params.key string Key params.value string Value params?.scope string <sup>(optional)</sup> Scope (default: device) params?.ttl integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Time in seconds

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result.success boolean Legacy parameter (always true) (default: True)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_PENDING_CONDITIONS Time is not synced ERROR_INVALID_INPUT_LENGTH Empty/too large namespace or key, or the storage doesn't have enough space ERROR_GENERAL Unknown error

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PersistentStore.1.setValue",
  "params": {
    "namespace": "ns1",
    "key": "key1",
    "value": "value1",
    "scope": "device",
    "ttl": 100
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "success": true
  }
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the PersistentStore interface:

PersistentStore interface events:

Notification Description onValueChanged Triggered whenever any of the values stored are changed using setValue

docs.title: onValueChanged <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Triggered whenever any of the values stored are changed using setValue.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.namespace string Namespace params.key string Key params.value string Value params.scope string Scope (default: device)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PersistentStore.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "onValueChanged",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.onValueChanged",
  "params": {
    "namespace": "ns1",
    "key": "key1",
    "value": "value1",
    "scope": "device"
  }
}

docs.title: start <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Starts a new container.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params?.name string <sup>(optional)</sup> Name of container params?.command string <sup>(optional)</sup> Command that will be started in the container params?.parameters array <sup>(optional)</sup> List of parameters supplied to command params?.parameters[#] string <sup>(optional)</sup> ...

docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Containers.1.start",
  "params": {
    "name": "ContainerName",
    "command": "lsof",
    "parameters": [
      "-i"
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

docs.text:

This property is read-only.

    "ContainerName"

docs.text:
Provides access to the list of network interfaces of the container.

This property is read-only.

The name argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Containers.1.networks@<name>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description name string ...

docs.title: Result

}

docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,

  "id": 42,

    ]

docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

docs.title: Remote Control API
docs.text:
Version: 1.0.0

Status:

RemoteControl interface for Thunder framework.

(Defined by RemoteControl.json)

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the RemoteControl interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: RemoteControl JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the RemoteControl interface:

RemoteControl interface methods:

Method Description key Gets key code details send Sends a key to a device (press and release) press Presses a key on a device release Releases a key on a device add Adds a key code to the key map modify Modifies a key code in the key map delete Deletes a key code from the key map load Re-loads the device's key map from persistent memory save Saves the device's key map into persistent path pair Activates pairing mode of a device unpair Unpairs a device

docs.title: key <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Gets key code details.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.device string Device name params.code integer Key code

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result.code integer Key code result.key integer Key ingest value result?.modifiers array <sup>(optional)</sup> List of key modifiers result?.modifiers[#] string <sup>(optional)</sup> Key modifier

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Key does not exist ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Unknown device ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Bad JSON param data format

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "RemoteControl.1.key",
  "params": {
    "device": "DevInput",
    "code": 1
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "code": 1,
    "key": 103,
    "modifiers": [
      "leftshift"
    ]
  }
}

docs.text: Sends a key to a device (press and release).

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Unknown device ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Bad JSON param data format ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Key does not exist ERROR_UNKNOWN_TABLE Key map table does not exist ERROR_ALREADY_RELEASED Key is already released

docs.title: Request

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,

    "device": "DevInput",

  }

docs.title: Response

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the RemoteControl interface:

RemoteControl interface properties:

Property Description devices (read-only) Names of all available devices device (read-only) Metadata of a specific device

docs.title: devices <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the names of all available devices.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Names of all available devices result[#] string Device name

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "RemoteControl.1.devices"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "Web"
  ]
}

docs.title: device <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the metadata of a specific device.

This property is read-only.

The device argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. RemoteControl.1.device@<device>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description device string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Metadata of a specific device result.metadata string Device metadata

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Metadata not supported on a virtual device ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Unknown device ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Bad JSON param data format

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "RemoteControl.1.device@DevInput"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "metadata": "It is based on protocol A"
  }
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the RemoteControl interface:

RemoteControl interface events:

Notification Description keypressed Notifies of a key press/release action

docs.title: keypressed <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of a key press/release action.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.pressed boolean Denotes if the key was pressed (true) or released (false)

The key code argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 42.client.keypressed.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "RemoteControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "keypressed",
    "id": "42.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "42.client.keypressed",
  "params": {
    "pressed": false
  }
}

docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the SecureShellServer interface:

SecureShellServer interface methods:

Method Description getactivesessionscount Get count of currently active SSH client sessions maintained by SecureShell SSH Service getactivesessionsinfo (read-only) Get details of currently active SSH client sessions maintained by SecureShell SSH Service closeclientsession Close and active SSH client session

docs.title: getactivesessionscount <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Get count of currently active SSH client sessions maintained by SecureShell SSH Service.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: With this method SecureShell SSH service shall provide the count of active SSH client sessions.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Number of client sessions count

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to get client sessions count ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Unknown error

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "SecureShellServer.1.getactivesessionscount"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: getactivesessionsinfo <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Get details of currently active SSH client sessions maintained by SecureShell SSH Service.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: With this method SecureShell SSH service shall provide the full details of active SSH client sessions.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array ... result[#] object ... result[#].pid integer SSH client process ID result[#].ipaddress string SSH client connected from this IP address result[#].timestamp string SSH client connected at this timestamp

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to get client sessions details ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Unknown error

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "SecureShellServer.1.getactivesessionsinfo"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "pid": 268,
      "ipaddress": "192.168.33.57",
      "timestamp": "Sun Jun 30 21:49:08 2019"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: closeclientsession <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Close and active SSH client session.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: With this method SecureShell an active SSH client session shall be closed.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.clientpid string SSH client process id (default: 268)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to close SSH client session ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Unknown error

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "SecureShellServer.1.closeclientsession",
  "params": {
    "clientpid": "268"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

SecurityAgent interface methods:

Method Description createtoken Creates Token validate Validates Token

docs.title: createtoken <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Creates Token.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create a signed JsonWeb token from provided payload.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params?.url string <sup>(optional)</sup> Url of application origin params?.user string <sup>(optional)</sup> Username params?.hash string <sup>(optional)</sup> Random hash

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result.token string Signed JsonWeb token

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Token creation failed

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "SecurityAgent.1.createtoken",
  "params": {
    "url": "https://test.comcast.com",
    "user": "Test",
    "hash": "1CLYex47SY"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.ewogICAgImpzb25ycGMiOiAiMi4wIiwgCiAgICAiaWQiOiAxMjM0NTY3ODkwLCAKICAgICJtZXRob2QiOiAiQ29udHJvbGxlci4xLmFjdGl2YXRlIiwgCiAgICAicGFyYW1zIjogewogICAgICAgICJjYWxsc2lnbiI6ICJTZWN1cml0eUFnZW50IgogICAgfQp9.lL40nTwRyBvMwiglZhl5_rB8ycY1uhAJRFx9pGATMRQ"
  }
}

docs.title: validate <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Validates Token.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Checks whether the token is valid and properly signed.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.token string Token that will be validated

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result.valid boolean Tells whether token is signature is correct

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "SecurityAgent.1.validate",
  "params": {
    "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.ewogICAgImpzb25ycGMiOiAiMi4wIiwgCiAgICAiaWQiOiAxMjM0NTY3ODkwLCAKICAgICJtZXRob2QiOiAiQ29udHJvbGxlci4xLmFjdGl2YXRlIiwgCiAgICAicGFyYW1zIjogewogICAgICAgICJjYWxsc2lnbiI6ICJTZWN1cml0eUFnZW50IgogICAgfQp9.lL40nTwRyBvMwiglZhl5_rB8ycY1uhAJRFx9pGATMRQ"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "valid": false
  }
}

docs.title: Sink API
docs.text:
Version: 1.0.0

Status:

Sink interface for Thunder framework.

(Defined with IBluetoothAudio::ISink in IBluetoothAudio.h)

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Sink interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sink JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Sink interface:

BluetoothAudio Sink interface methods:

Method Description sink::assign Assigns a Bluetooth sink device for audio playback sink::revoke Revokes a Bluetooth sink device from audio playback

docs.title: sink::assign <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Assigns a Bluetooth sink device for audio playback.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Address of the bluetooth device to assign

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Device address value is invalid ERROR_ALREADY_CONNECTED A sink device is already assigned

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::assign",
  "params": {
    "address": "..."
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: sink::revoke <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Revokes a Bluetooth sink device from audio playback.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ALREADY_RELEASED No device is currently assigned as sink

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::revoke"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the Sink interface:

BluetoothAudio Sink interface properties:

Property Description sink::state (read-only) Current state o the audio sink device sink::device (read-only) Bluetooth address of the audio sink device sink::type (read-only) Type of the audio sink device sink::latency Latency of the audio sink device sink::supportedcodecs (read-only) Audio codecs supported by the audio sink device sink::supporteddrms (read-only) DRM schemes supported by the audio sink device sink::codec (read-only) Properites of the currently used audio codec sink::drm (read-only) Properites of the currently used DRM scheme sink::stream (read-only) Properties of the currently transmitted audio stream

docs.title: sink::state <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the current state o the audio sink device.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Current state o the audio sink device (must be one of the following: Connected, ConnectedBad, ConnectedRestricted, Connecting, Disconnected, Ready, Streaming, Unassigned)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::state"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "Unassigned"
}

docs.title: sink::device <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the bluetooth address of the audio sink device.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Bluetooth address of the audio sink device

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE The sink device currently is not assigned

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::device"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "..."
}

docs.title: sink::type <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the type of the audio sink device.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Type of the audio sink device (must be one of the following: Amplifier, Headphone, Recorder, Speaker, Unknown)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE The sink device currently is not connected

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::type"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "Unknown"
}

docs.title: sink::latency <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the latency of the audio sink device.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Latency of the audio sink device (property).value integer Audio latency in milliseconds

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Latency of the audio sink device

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Latency value is invalid

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::latency"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::latency",
  "params": {
    "value": 20
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: sink::supportedcodecs <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the audio codecs supported by the audio sink device.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Audio codecs supported by the audio sink device result[#] string ... (must be one of the following: LC-SBC)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE The sink device currently is not connected

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::supportedcodecs"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "LC-SBC"
  ]
}

docs.title: sink::supporteddrms <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the DRM schemes supported by the audio sink device.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array DRM schemes supported by the audio sink device result[#] string ... (must be one of the following: DTCP, SCMS-T)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE The sink device currently is not connected

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::supporteddrms"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "DTCP"
  ]
}

docs.title: sink::codec <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the properites of the currently used audio codec.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Properites of the currently used audio codec result.codec string Audio codec used (must be one of the following: LC-SBC) result.settings opaque object Codec-specific audio quality preset, compression profile, etc

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE The sink device currently is not configured

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::codec"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "codec": "LC-SBC",
    "settings": {}
  }
}

docs.title: sink::drm <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the properites of the currently used DRM scheme.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Properites of the currently used DRM scheme result.drm string Content protection scheme used (must be one of the following: DTCP, SCMS-T) result.settings opaque object DRM-specific content protection level, encoding rules, etc

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE The sink device currently is not connected or not yet configured

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::drm"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "drm": "DTCP",
    "settings": {}
  }
}

docs.title: sink::stream <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the properties of the currently transmitted audio stream.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Properties of the currently transmitted audio stream result.samplerate integer Sample rate in Hz result.bitrate integer Target bitrate in bits per second (eg. 320000) result.channels integer Number of audio channels result.resolution integer Sampling resolution in bits per sample result.isresampled boolean Indicates if the source stream is being resampled by the stack to match sink capabilities

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE The sink device currently is not connected or not yet configured

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.sink::stream"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "samplerate": 44100,
    "bitrate": 0,
    "channels": 2,
    "resolution": 16,
    "isresampled": false
  }
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Sink interface:

BluetoothAudio Sink interface events:

Notification Description sink::statechanged Signals audio sink state change

docs.title: sink::statechanged <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals audio sink state change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.state string Changed BluetoothAudio State (must be one of the following: Connected, ConnectedBad, ConnectedRestricted, Connecting, Disconnected, Ready, Streaming, Unassigned)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Sink.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "sink::statechanged",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.sink::statechanged",
  "params": {
    "state": "Unassigned"
  }
}

docs.title: Spark API

Version: 1.0.0

Status:

Spark interface for Thunder framework.

• Introduction
  • Description
  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Spark interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Spark JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Spark interface:

Browser interface methods:

Method Description delete Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage

docs.title: delete <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to recursively delete contents of a directory

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.path string Path to directory (within the persistent storage) to delete contents of

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY The given path was incorrect

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.delete",
  "params": {
    "path": ".cache/wpe/disk-cache"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the Spark interface:

Browser interface properties:

Property Description url URL loaded in the browser visibility Current browser visibility fps (read-only) Current number of frames per second the browser is rendering

StateControl interface properties:

Property Description state Running state of the service

docs.title: url <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the URL loaded in the browser.

Also see: urlchange

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string URL loaded in the browser

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string URL loaded in the browser

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_INCORRECT_URL Incorrect URL given

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.url"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "https://www.google.com"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.url",
  "params": "https://www.google.com"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Spark interface:

Browser interface events:

Notification Description urlchange Signals a URL change in the browser visibilitychange Signals a visibility change of the browser

StateControl interface events:

Notification Description statechange Signals a state change of the service

docs.title: urlchange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a URL change in the browser.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.url string The URL that has been loaded or requested params.loaded boolean Determines if the URL has just been loaded (true) or if URL change has been requested (false) (default: True)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "urlchange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.urlchange",
  "params": {
    "url": "https://www.google.com",
    "loaded": false
  }
}

docs.title: visibilitychange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a visibility change of the browser.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.hidden boolean Determines if the browser has been hidden (true) or made visible (false)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "visibilitychange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.visibilitychange",
  "params": {
    "hidden": false
  }
}

docs.title: statechange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a state change of the service.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.suspended boolean Determines if the service has entered suspended state (true) or resumed state (false)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "statechange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.statechange",
  "params": {
    "suspended": false
  }
}
