docs.title: Streamer API
docs.text:
Version: 1.0.0

Status:

Streamer interface for Thunder framework.

(Defined by Streamer.json)

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Streamer interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Streamer JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Streamer interface:

Streamer interface methods:

Method Description create Creates a stream instance destroy Destroys a stream instance load Loads a source into a stream attach Attaches a decoder to the streamer detach Detaches a decoder from the streamer

docs.title: create <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Creates a stream instance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Stream type

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Stream ID

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Invalid stream type given ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Fronted of the selected stream type is not available

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.create",
  "params": {
    "type": "cable"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: destroy <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Destroys a stream instance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Stream ID

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.destroy",
  "params": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: load <sup>method</sup>
docs.text:
Loads a source into a stream.

Also see: statechange

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Stream ID params.location string Location of the source to load

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_INCORRECT_URL Invalid location given ERROR_GENERAL Undefined loading error ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Stream is not in a valid state

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.load",
  "params": {
    "id": 0,
    "location": "http://example.com/sample.m3u8"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: attach <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Attaches a decoder to the streamer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Stream ID

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_INPROGRESS Decoder already attached ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Stream is not in a valid state ERROR_UNAVAILABLE No free decoders available

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.attach",
  "params": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: detach <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Detaches a decoder from the streamer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Stream ID

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Stream is not in a valid state or decoder not attached ERROR_INPROGRESS Decoder is in use

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.detach",
  "params": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the Streamer interface:

Streamer interface properties:

Property Description speed Playback speed position Stream position window Stream playback window speeds (read-only) Speeds supported by the stream player streams (read-only) All created stream instance IDs type (read-only) Type of a stream drm (read-only) DRM type associated with a stream state (read-only) Current state of a stream metadata (read-only) Metadata associated with the stream error (read-only) Most recent error code elements (read-only) Stream elements

docs.title: speed <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the playback speed.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Speed (in percentage)

Also see: statechange

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.speed@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) integer Speed percentage; e.g.: 0 - pause, 100 - normal playback, -100 - rewind, -200 - reverse at twice the normal speed, 50 - forward at half speed, etc. Must be one of the speeds supported by the player

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Speed percentage; e.g.: 0 - pause, 100 - normal playback, -100 - rewind, -200 - reverse at twice the normal speed, 50 - forward at half speed, etc. Must be one of the speeds supported by the player

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Player is not in a valid state or decoder not attached

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.speed@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 100
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.speed@0",
  "params": 100
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: position <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the stream position.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.position@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) integer Position (in milliseconds)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Position (in milliseconds)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Player is not in a valid state or decoder not attached

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.position@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 60000
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.position@0",
  "params": 60000
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: window <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the stream playback window.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.window@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Geometry of the window (property).x integer Horizontal position of the window (in pixels) (property).y integer Vertical position of the window (in pixels) (property).width integer Width of the window (in pixels) (property).height integer Height of the window (in pixels)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Geometry of the window result.x integer Horizontal position of the window (in pixels) result.y integer Vertical position of the window (in pixels) result.width integer Width of the window (in pixels) result.height integer Height of the window (in pixels)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Player is not in a valid state or decoder not attached

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.window@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "x": 0,
    "y": 0,
    "width": 1080,
    "height": 720
  }
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.window@0",
  "params": {
    "x": 0,
    "y": 0,
    "width": 1080,
    "height": 720
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: speeds <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the speeds supported by the stream player.

This property is read-only.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.speeds@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Supported speeds (in percentage) result[#] integer (speeds in percentage)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Player is not in a valid state or decoder not attached

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.speeds@0"
}

docs.title: streams <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the all created stream instance IDs.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Stream IDs result[#] integer (a stream ID)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.streams"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    0,
    1,
    2,
    3
  ]
}

docs.title: type <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the type of a stream.

This property is read-only.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.type@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Stream type

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.type@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "cable"
}

docs.title: drm <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the DRM type associated with a stream.

This property is read-only.

Also see: drmchange

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.drm@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string DRM used

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.drm@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "clearkey"
}

docs.title: state <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the current state of a stream.

This property is read-only.

Also see: statechange

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.state@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Stream state

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given

docs.title: Get Request

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.state@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "controlled"
}

docs.title: metadata <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the metadata associated with the stream.

This property is read-only.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.metadata@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Custom implementation-specific metadata

docs.title: Errors

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.metadata@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "..."
}

docs.title: error <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the most recent error code.

This property is read-only.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.error@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Result

docs.title: Errors

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.error@0"

docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0

docs.title: elements <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the stream elements.

This property is read-only.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.elements@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array List of stream elements result[#] object Stream element result[#].type string Stream element type

docs.title: Errors

    {
      "type": "video"

  ]

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Streamer interface:

Streamer interface events:

Notification Description statechange Notifies of stream state change timeupdate Notifies of stream position change stream Notifies of a custom stream incident player Notifies of a custom player incident drm Notifies of a custom DRM-related incident

docs.title: statechange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of stream state change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.state string Stream state

The Stream ID argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 0.client.statechange.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "statechange",
    "id": "0.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "0.client.statechange",
  "params": {
    "state": "controlled"
  }
}

docs.title: timeupdate <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of stream position change. This event is fired every second to indicate the current stream position. It does not fire if the stream is paused (i.e. speed is set to 0).

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.time integer Stream position in miliseconds

The Stream ID argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 0.client.timeupdate.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "timeupdate",
    "id": "0.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "0.client.timeupdate",
  "params": {
    "time": 30000
  }
}

docs.title: stream <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of a custom stream incident.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.code integer Implementation-specific incident code

The Stream ID argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 0.client.stream.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "stream",
    "id": "0.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "0.client.stream",
  "params": {
    "code": 1
  }
}

docs.title: player <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of a custom player incident.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.code integer Implementation-specific incident code

The Stream ID argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 0.client.player.

docs.title: Registration

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

    "id": "0.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "0.client.player",
  "params": {
    "code": 1
  }
}

docs.title: drm <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of a custom DRM-related incident.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.code integer Implementation-specific incident code

The Stream ID argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 0.client.drm.

docs.title: Registration

docs.title: Subsystem Control API
docs.text:
Version: 1.0.0

Status:

SubsystemControl interface for Thunder framework.

(Defined by SubsystemControl.json)

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Methods

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the SubsystemControl interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods provided.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: SubsystemControl JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the SubsystemControl interface:

SubsystemControl interface methods:

Method Description activate Activates a subsystem deactivate Deactivates a subsystem

docs.title: activate <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Activates a subsystem.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method allows a subsystem to be activated from the outside. This is usefull in case Thunder can not determine the availability of a subsystem but it needs to be triggered from the outside.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.system string Subsystem to activate params?.configuration string <sup>(optional)</sup> A JSON string that holds the information applicable to the subsystem to be activated

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer The result of the activating anythin unequal to 0 means somthing failed

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "SubsystemControl.1.activate",
  "params": {
    "system": "network",
    "configuration": "..."
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: deactivate <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Deactivates a subsystem.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method allows a subsystem to be deactivated from the outside. This is usefull in case Thunder can not determine the availability of a subsystem but it needs to be triggered from the outside.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params string Subsystem to deactivate

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "SubsystemControl.1.deactivate",
  "params": "network"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the TimeSync interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: TimeSync JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the TimeSync interface:

TimeSync interface methods:

Method Description synchronize Synchronizes time

docs.title: synchronize <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Synchronizes time.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to synchronize the system time with the currently configured time source. If automatic time synchronization is initially disabled or stopped, it will be restarted.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_INPROGRESS Returned when the method is called while previously triggered synchronization is in progress. ERROR_INCOMPLETE_CONFIG Returned when the source configuration is missing or invalid.

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.synchronize"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the TimeSync interface:

TimeSync interface properties:

Property Description synctime (read-only) Most recent synchronized time time Current system time

docs.title: synctime <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the most recent synchronized time.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Most recent synchronized time result.time string Synchronized time (in ISO8601 format); empty string if the time has never been synchronized result?.source string <sup>(optional)</sup> The synchronization source e.g. an NTP server

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.synctime"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "time": "2019-05-07T07:20:26Z",
    "source": "ntp://example.com"
  }
}

docs.title: time <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the current system time.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Upon setting this property automatic time synchronization will be stopped. Usage of this property is deprecated and the SubSystem control plugin can be used as an alternative to achieve the same

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string System time (in ISO8601 format)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string System time (in ISO8601 format)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST The time is invalid

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.time"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.time",
  "params": "2019-05-07T07:20:26Z"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the TimeSync interface:

TimeSync interface events:

Notification Description timechange Signals a time change

docs.title: timechange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a time change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This notification carries no parameters.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "timechange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.timechange"
}

docs.title: Case Sensitivity

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: TraceControl JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the TraceControl interface:

TraceControl interface methods:

Method Description status Retrieves general information set Sets traces

docs.title: status <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Retrieves general information.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieves the actual trace status information for targeted module and category, if either category nor module is given, all information is returned. It will retrieves the details about console status and remote address(port and binding address), if these are configured.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.module string Module name params.category string Category name

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result.console boolean Config attribute (Console) result.remote object Config attribute (Remote) result.remote.port integer Config attribute (port) result.remote.binding string Config attribute (binding) result.settings array Trace info list result.settings[#] object ... result.settings[#].module string Module name result.settings[#].category string Category name result.settings[#].state string State value

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TraceControl.1.status",
  "params": {
    "module": "Plugin_Monitor",
    "category": "Information"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "console": false,
    "remote": {
      "port": 2200,
      "binding": "0.0.0.0"
    },
    "settings": [
      {
        "module": "Plugin_Monitor",
        "category": "Information",
        "state": "disabled"
      }
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: set <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Sets traces.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Disables/enables all/select category traces for particular module.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.module string Module name params.category string Category name params.state string State value

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TraceControl.1.set",
  "params": {
    "module": "Plugin_Monitor",
    "category": "Information",
    "state": "disabled"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: ValuePoint API
docs.text:
Version: 1.0.0

Status:

ValuePoint interface for Thunder framework.

(Defined with IValuePoint in IValuePoint.h)

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the ValuePoint interface (version 1.0.0). It includes detailed specification about its properties provided and notifications sent.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text: ValuePoint JSON-RPC interface.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the ValuePoint interface:

ValuePoint interface properties:

Property Description identifier (read-only) Each IValuePoint instance has a unique identifier that identifies the instance bundle (read-only) If this IValuePoint belongs to a bundle that has multiple IValuePoints the id that identifies the bundle and the result will be Core::ERROR_NONE condition (read-only) Current state/condition of this IValuePoint type (read-only) Characteristics of this IValuePoint(IElement) minimum (read-only) The minimum value this IValuePoint(IElement) can reach maximum (read-only) The maximum value this IValuePoint(IElement) can reach value The current value of this IValuePoint metadata (read-only) There most be more than meets the eye, report it as a JSON string

docs.title: identifier <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the each IValuePoint instance has a unique identifier that identifies the instance. The value returned here return the unique ID of this IValuePoint.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Each IValuePoint instance has a unique identifier that identifies the instance. The value returned here return the unique ID of this IValuePoint

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.identifier"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: bundle <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the if this IValuePoint belongs to a bundle that has multiple IValuePoints the id that identifies the bundle and the result will be Core::ERROR_NONE. If it does not belong to a bundle, this call returns Core::ERROR_UNAVAILABLE,.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer If this IValuePoint belongs to a bundle that has multiple IValuePoints the id that identifies the bundle and the result will be Core::ERROR_NONE. If it does not belong to a bundle, this call returns Core::ERROR_UNAVAILABLE,

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.bundle"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: condition <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the current state/condition of this IValuePoint.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Current state/condition of this IValuePoint (must be one of the following: Activated, Constructing, Deactivated)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.condition"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "Constructing"
}

docs.title: type <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the characteristics of this IValuePoint(IElement).

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Characteristics of this IValuePoint(IElement)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.type"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: minimum <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the the minimum value this IValuePoint(IElement) can reach.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer The minimum value this IValuePoint(IElement) can reach

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.minimum"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: maximum <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the the maximum value this IValuePoint(IElement) can reach.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer The maximum value this IValuePoint(IElement) can reach

docs.title: Get Request

  "id": 42,
  "result": 0

docs.title: value <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the the current value of this IValuePoint.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object The current value of this IValuePoint (property).value integer ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Represent the current value of this IValuePoint

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.value"

docs.title: Get Response

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.value",
  "params": {
    "value": 0
  }

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: metadata <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the there most be more than meets the eye, report it as a JSON string.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string There most be more than meets the eye, report it as a JSON string

docs.title: Get Request

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",

docs.title: Get Response

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the ValuePoint interface:

ValuePoint interface events:

Notification Description update Signal event any change in value metadata Signal event any change in Metadata

docs.title: update <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signal event any change in value.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Id of the value

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "update",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.update",
  "params": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

docs.title: metadata <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signal event any change in Metadata.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Id of the Metadata

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ValuePoint.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "metadata",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.metadata",
  "params": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

The following properties are provided by the VolumeControl interface:

Property Description muted Audio mute state volume Audio volume level

docs.title: muted <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the audio mute state.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) boolean Mute state (true: muted, false: un-muted)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result boolean Mute state (true: muted, false: un-muted)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to set/retrieve muting state

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "VolumeControl.1.muted"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": false
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "VolumeControl.1.muted",
  "params": false
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: volume <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the audio volume level.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) integer Volume level in percent

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Volume level in percent

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to set/retrieve audio volume

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "VolumeControl.1.volume"
}

docs.title: Get Response

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "VolumeControl.1.volume",
  "params": 100
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the VolumeControl interface:

VolumeControl interface events:

Notification Description volume Signals volume change muted Signals mute state change

docs.title: volume <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals volume change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.volume integer New bolume level in percent

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "VolumeControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "volume",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.volume",
  "params": {
    "volume": 100
  }
}

docs.title: muted <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals mute state change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.muted boolean New mute state (true: muted, false: un-muted)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "VolumeControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "muted",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.muted",
  "params": {
    "muted": false
  }
}

docs.text: WebBrowser JSON-RPC interface.

The following methods are provided by the WebBrowser interface:

WebBrowser interface methods:

Method Description collectgarbage Initiate garbage collection

Property Description url Page loaded in the browser visibility Browser window visibility state fps (read-only) Current framerate the browser is rendering at useragent UserAgent string used by the browser localstorageenabled Controls the local storage availability httpcookieacceptpolicy HTTP cookies accept policy bridgereply (write-only) Response for legacy $badger bridgeevent (write-only) Send legacy $badger event

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the WebBrowser interface:

WebBrowser interface events:

Notification Description loadfinished Initial HTML document has been completely loaded and parsed loadfailed Browser failed to load page urlchange Signals a URL change in the browser visibilitychange Signals a visibility change of the browser pageclosure Notifies that the web page requests to close its window

docs.title: loadfinished <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Initial HTML document has been completely loaded and parsed.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.url string The URL that has been loaded params.httpstatus integer The response code of main resource request

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WebBrowser.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "loadfinished",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.loadfinished",
  "params": {
    "url": "https://example.com",
    "httpstatus": 200

The following methods are provided by the WebKitBrowser interface:

WebKitBrowser interface methods:

Method Description delete Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage

docs.title: delete <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to recursively delete contents of a directory

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.path string Path to directory (within the persistent storage) to delete contents of

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY The given path was incorrect

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WebKitBrowser.1.delete",
  "params": {
    "path": ".cache/wpe/disk-cache"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the WifiControl interface:

WifiControl interface properties:

Property Description networks (read-only) Provides available networks information securities (read-only) Provides security method of requested SSID configs (read-only) Provides configs list config Provide config details for requested SSID

docs.title: networks <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the provides available networks information.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Provides available networks information result[#] object ... result[#].ssid string SSID of the network result[#].bssid integer BSSID of the network result[#].frequency integer Frequency used result[#].signal integer Signal strength result[#].security array Security method result[#].security[#] string ... (must be one of the following: Enterprise, Open, Unknown, WEP, WPA, WPA2, WPA_WPA2, WPS)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WifiControl.1.networks"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "ssid": "...",
      "bssid": 0,
      "frequency": 0,
      "signal": 0,
      "security": [
        "Open"
      ]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: securities <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the provides security method of requested SSID.

This property is read-only.

The ssid argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. WifiControl.1.securities@<ssid>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description ssid string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Provides security method of requested SSID result[#] object ... result[#].method string Security method (must be one of the following: Enterprise, Open, Unknown, WEP, WPA, WPA2, WPA_WPA2, WPS) result[#].keys array Security Keys result[#].keys[#] string ... (must be one of the following: CCMP, EAP, None, PBC, PIN, PSK, PSK_HASHED, Preauth, TKIP)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WifiControl.1.securities@xyz"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "method": "Open",
      "keys": [
        "PSK"
      ]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: configs <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the provides configs list.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Provides configs list result[#] string ...

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WifiControl.1.configs"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "..."
  ]
}

docs.title: config <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the provide config details for requested SSID.

The ssid argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. WifiControl.1.config@<ssid>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description ssid string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Provide config details for requested SSID (property).value object ... (property).value.hidden boolean Visibility of the router (hidden or visible) (property).value.accesspoint boolean Accesspoint or not (property).value.ssid string SSID of the router/ap (property).value.secret string Secret key used (property).value.identity string Identity (property).value.method string Security method (must be one of the following: Enterprise, Open, Unknown, WEP, WPA, WPA2, WPA_WPA2, WPS) (property).value.key string Security Info: method and keys (must be one of the following: CCMP, EAP, None, PBC, PIN, PSK, PSK_HASHED, Preauth, TKIP)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Details about requested SSID result.hidden boolean Visibility of the router (hidden or visible) result.accesspoint boolean Accesspoint or not result.ssid string SSID of the router/ap result.secret string Secret key used result.identity string Identity result.method string Security method (must be one of the following: Enterprise, Open, Unknown, WEP, WPA, WPA2, WPA_WPA2, WPS) result.key string Security Info: method and keys (must be one of the following: CCMP, EAP, None, PBC, PIN, PSK, PSK_HASHED, Preauth, TKIP)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WifiControl.1.config@xyz"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "hidden": false,
    "accesspoint": false,
    "ssid": "...",
    "secret": "...",
    "identity": "...",
    "method": "Open",
    "key": "PSK"
  }
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WifiControl.1.config@xyz",
  "params": {
    "value": {
      "hidden": false,
      "accesspoint": false,
      "ssid": "...",
      "secret": "...",
      "identity": "...",
      "method": "Open",
      "key": "PSK"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

Property Description permutable / accept To allow new devices to the network, the controller should be placed into an accepting mode devices (read-only) Get the information of available devices

docs.title: permutable <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the to allow new devices to the network, the controller should be placed into an accepting mode. By enabling this mode, the controller can accept new devices.

accept is an alternative name for this property.

The address argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. ZigWave.1.permutable@<address>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description address integer ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object To allow new devices to the network, the controller should be placed into an accepting mode. By enabling this mode, the controller can accept new devices (property).value boolean ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result boolean Enabled (true) or Disable (false) the accepting mode

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ZigWave.1.permutable@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": false
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ZigWave.1.permutable@0",
  "params": {
    "value": false
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: devices <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the get the information of available devices. An id of 0xFFFFFFFF means all devices available by this plugin.

This property is read-only.

The id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. ZigWave.1.devices@<id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description id integer ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Get the information of available devices. An id of 0xFFFFFFFF means all devices available by this plugin result[#] object ... result[#].parent integer Address of the Parent result[#].address integer Address of the device result[#].type string Type of the device (must be one of the following: Controller, EndDevice, Router) result[#].manufacturer integer Manufactured of this device result[#].metadata string Metadata associated with this device

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "ZigWave.1.devices@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "parent": 0,
      "address": 0,
      "type": "EndDevice",
      "manufacturer": 0,
      "metadata": "..."
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: AVS Plugin
docs.text:
Version: 1.0

Status:

AVS plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Configuration
  • Interfaces
  • Methods
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the AVS plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, methods provided and notifications sent.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Alexa Voice Service Headless Client serves as a personal assistant.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: AVS) classname string Class name: AVS locator string Library name: libThunderAVS.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration.alexaclientconfig string The path to the AlexaClientSDKConfig.json (e.g /usr/share/Thunder/AVS/AlexaClientSDKConfig.json) configuration?.smartscreenconfig string (optional) The path to the SmartScreenSDKConfig.json (e.g /usr/share/Thunder/AVS/SmartScreenSDKConfig.json). This config will be used only when SmartScreen functionality is enabled configuration?.kwdmodelspath string (optional) Path to the Keyword Detection models (e.g /usr/share/Thunder/AVS/models). The path mus contain the localeToModels.json file configuration?.loglevel string (optional) Capitalized log level of the AVS components. Possible values: NONE, CRITICAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO. Debug log levels start from DEBUG0 up to DEBUG0 configuration.audiosource string The callsign of the plugin that provides the voice audio input or PORTAUDIO, when the portaudio library should be used. (e.g BluetoothRemoteControll, PORTAUDIO) configuration?.enablesmartscreen boolean (optional) Enable the SmartScreen support in the runtime. The SmartScreen functionality must be compiled in configuration?.enablekwd boolean (optional) Enable the Keyword Detection engine in the runtime. The KWD functionality must be compiled in

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • IAVSController (IAVSClient.h) (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-collapsed format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the AVS plugin:

AVSController interface methods:

Method Description mute Mutes the audio output of AVS record Starts or stops the voice recording, skipping keyword detection

docs.title: Parameters

  "result": null
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the AVS plugin:

AVSController interface events:

Notification Description dialoguestatechange Notifies about dialogue state changes

docs.title: dialoguestatechange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies about dialogue state changes.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params string The new state (must be one of the following: Expecting, Idle, Listening, Speaking, Thinking)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "AVS.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "dialoguestatechange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.dialoguestatechange",
  "params": "SPEAKING"
}

docs.title: Bluetooth Audio Plugin

Version: 1.0

Status:

BluetoothAudio plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Table of Contents

• Introduction
  • Description
  • Configuration
  • Interfaces
  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the BluetoothAudio plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface BR/EDR Basic Rate/Enhanced Data Rate HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON LC-SBC Low-Complexity SubBand Coding

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description bitpool A parameter to the LC-SBC codec that changes the encoding bitrate; the higher it is the higher the bitrate and thus the audio quality callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Bluetooth Audio Sink plugin enables audio streaming to Bluetooth audio sink devices. The plugin is sink a from the host device stack perspective; in Bluetooth topology the host device becomes in fact an audio source. The plugin requires a Bluetooth controller service that will provide Bluetooth BR/EDR scanning, pairing and connection functionality; typically this is fulfiled by the BluetoothControl plugin.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: BluetoothAudio) classname string Class name: BluetoothAudio locator string Library name: libThunderBluetoothAudio.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework controller string (optional) Callsign of the Bluetooth controller service (typically BluetoothControl) server object (optional) BluetoothAudio server configuration server?.interface integer (optional) Bluetooth interface to listen to for incomming connections server?.inactivitytimeout integer (optional) Timeout to drop inactive connections (in ms) server?.psm integer (optional) Port to listen to for incomming conections (typically 25) sink object (optional) BluetoothAudio sink configuration sink.codecs object Codec settings sink.codecs.LC-SBC object Settings for the LC-SBC codec sink.codecs.LC-SBC?.preset string (optional) Predefined audio quality setting sink.codecs.LC-SBC?.bitpool integer (optional) Custom audio quality based on bitpool value (used when preset is not specified) sink.codecs.LC-SBC?.channelmode string (optional) Channel mode for custom audio quality (used when preset is not specified) source object (optional) BluetoothAudio source configuration source.codecs object Codec settings source.codecs?.LC-SBC object (optional) Settings for the LC-SBC codec source.codecs?.LC-SBC.maxbitpool integer Maximum accepted bitpool value

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • IBluetoothAudio::ISink (IBluetoothAudio.h) (version 1.0.0) (compliant format)
  • IBluetoothAudio::ISource (IBluetoothAudio.h) (version 1.0.0) (compliant format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the BluetoothAudio plugin:

BluetoothAudio Sink interface methods:

Method Description sink::assign Assigns a Bluetooth sink device for audio playback sink::revoke Revokes a Bluetooth sink device from audio playback

docs.title: sink::assign <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Assigns a Bluetooth sink device for audio playback.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Address of the bluetooth device to assign

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Device address value is invalid ERROR_ALREADY_CONNECTED A sink device is already assigned

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothAudio.1.sink::assign",
  "params": {
    "address": "..."
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: sink::revoke <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Revokes a Bluetooth sink device from audio playback.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Errors

docs.title: Request

}

  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the BluetoothAudio plugin:

BluetoothAudio Sink interface properties:

Property Description sink::state (read-only) Current state o the audio sink device sink::device (read-only) Bluetooth address of the audio sink device sink::type (read-only) Type of the audio sink device sink::latency Latency of the audio sink device sink::supportedcodecs (read-only) Audio codecs supported by the audio sink device sink::supporteddrms (read-only) DRM schemes supported by the audio sink device sink::codec (read-only) Properites of the currently used audio codec sink::drm (read-only) Properites of the currently used DRM scheme sink::stream (read-only) Properties of the currently transmitted audio stream

BluetoothAudio Source interface properties:

Property Description source::state (read-only) Current state of the source device source::device (read-only) Bluetooth address of the source device source::type (read-only) Type of the audio source device source::codec (read-only) Properites of the currently used codec source::drm (read-only) Properties of the currently used DRM scheme source::stream (read-only) Properites of the currently transmitted audio stream
