This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Properties of the currently used DRM scheme result.drm string Content protection scheme used (must be one of the following: DTCP, SCMS-T) result.settings opaque object DRM-specific content protection level, encoding rules, etc

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE No source device is connected or sink is not yet configured

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothAudio.1.source::drm"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "drm": "DTCP",
    "settings": {}
  }
}

docs.title: source::stream <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the properites of the currently transmitted audio stream.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Properites of the currently transmitted audio stream result.samplerate integer Sample rate in Hz result.bitrate integer Target bitrate in bits per second (eg. 320000) result.channels integer Number of audio channels result.resolution integer Sampling resolution in bits per sample result.isresampled boolean Indicates if the source stream is being resampled by the stack to match sink capabilities

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE No source device is connected or sink is not yet configured

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothAudio.1.source::stream"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "samplerate": 44100,
    "bitrate": 0,
    "channels": 2,
    "resolution": 16,
    "isresampled": false
  }
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the BluetoothAudio plugin:

BluetoothAudio Sink interface events:

Notification Description sink::statechanged Signals audio sink state change

BluetoothAudio Source interface events:

Notification Description source::statechanged Signals audio source state change

docs.title: sink::statechanged <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals audio sink state change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.state string Changed BluetoothAudio State (must be one of the following: Connected, ConnectedBad, ConnectedRestricted, Connecting, Disconnected, Ready, Streaming, Unassigned)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothAudio.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "sink::statechanged",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.sink::statechanged",
  "params": {
    "state": "Unassigned"
  }
}

docs.title: source::statechanged <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals audio source state change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.state string Changed BluetoothAudio State (must be one of the following: Connected, ConnectedBad, ConnectedRestricted, Connecting, Disconnected, Ready, Streaming, Unassigned)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothAudio.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "source::statechanged",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.source::statechanged",
  "params": {
    "state": "Unassigned"
  }
}

docs.title: Bluetooth Control Plugin
docs.text:
Version: 1.0

Status:

BluetoothControl plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Configuration
  • Interfaces
  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the BluetoothControl plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Bluetooth Control plugin allows Bluetooth device administration.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: BluetoothControl) classname string Class name: BluetoothControl locator string Library name: libThunderBluetoothControl.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.interface integer (optional) ID of the local Bluetooth interface configuration?.autopasskeyconfirm boolean (optional) Enable automatic passkey confirmation (may pose a security risk) configuration?.persistmac boolean (optional) Enable persistent Bluetooth address configuration?.name String (optional) Name of the local Bluetooth interface configuration?.shortname String (optional) Shortened name of the local Bluetooth interface configuration?.class integer (optional) Class of device value of the local Bluetooth interface configuration?.uuids array (optional) UUIDs to include in the outbound EIR/AD blocks configuration?.uuids[#] object (optional) (UUID entry) configuration?.uuids[#]?.callsign string (optional) Callsign of the plugin providing the service configuration?.uuids[#]?.uuid string (optional) UUID value (short or long) configuration?.uuids[#]?.service integer (optional) Corresponding service bit in Class of Device value

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • BluetoothControl.json (version 1.0.0) (compliant format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the BluetoothControl plugin:

BluetoothControl interface methods:

Method Description setdiscoverable Starts advertising (or inquiry scanning), making the local interface visible by nearby Bluetooth devices stopdiscoverable Stops advertising (or inquiry scanning) operation scan Starts active discovery (or inquiry) of nearby Bluetooth devices stopscanning Stops discovery (or inquiry) operation connect Connects to a Bluetooth device disconnect Disconnects from a connected Bluetooth device pair Pairs a Bluetooth device unpair Unpairs a paired Bluetooth device abortpairing Aborts pairing operation providepincode Provides a PIN-code for authentication during a legacy pairing process providepasskey Provides a passkey for authentication during a pairing process confirmpasskey Confirms a passkey for authentication during a pairing process forget Forgets a known Bluetooth device getdevicelist Retrieves a list of known remote Bluetooth devices getdeviceinfo Retrieves detailed information about a known Bluetooth device

docs.title: setdiscoverable <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Starts advertising (or inquiry scanning), making the local interface visible by nearby Bluetooth devices.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Please note that discoverable state in Limited mode for Bluetooth Classic is bounded to 30 seconds only.

Also see: discoverablestarted, discoverablecomplete

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Discoverable type (default: LowEnergy) params?.mode string <sup>(optional)</sup> Discoverable mode (default: General) params?.connectable boolean <sup>(optional)</sup> Selects connectable advertising (true, LowEnergy only) (default: False) params?.duration integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Duration of the discoverable operation (in seconds) (default: 30)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed set discoverable state ERROR_INPROGRESS Discoverable state of selected type is already in progress

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.setdiscoverable",
  "params": {
    "type": "LowEnergy",
    "mode": "General",
    "connectable": false,
    "duration": 30
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: stopdiscoverable <sup>method</sup>
docs.text:
Stops advertising (or inquiry scanning) operation.

Also see: discoverablecomplete

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Discoverable type (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to top scanning ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Adapter is in not discoverable state of selected type

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.stopdiscoverable",
  "params": {
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: scan <sup>method</sup>
docs.text:
Starts active discovery (or inquiry) of nearby Bluetooth devices.

Also see: scanstarted, scancomplete

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Scan type (default: LowEnergy) params?.mode string <sup>(optional)</sup> Scan mode (default: General) params?.timeout integer <sup>(deprecated)</sup> <sup>(optional)</sup> Duration of the scan (in seconds) (default: 10) params?.duration integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Duration of the scan (in seconds) (default: 10)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to scan ERROR_INPROGRESS Scan of selected type is already in progress

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.scan",
  "params": {
    "type": "LowEnergy",
    "mode": "General",
    "duration": 60
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: stopscanning <sup>method</sup>
docs.text:
Stops discovery (or inquiry) operation.

Also see: scancomplete

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params?.type string <sup>(optional)</sup> Scan type (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to top scanning ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Scan of selected type is not in progress

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.stopscanning",
  "params": {
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: connect <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Connects to a Bluetooth device.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
This call also enables automatic reconnection of the device. If the device is currently not available it will be automatically connected as soon it becomes available.

Also see: devicestatechange

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params?.type string <sup>(optional)</sup> Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Device not paired ERROR_ALREADY_CONNECTED Device already connected ERROR_GENERAL Failed to connect the device ERROR_REQUEST_SUBMITTED Device has not been connected but will be automatically connected when available

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.connect",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: disconnect <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Disconnects from a connected Bluetooth device.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
This call also disables automatic reconnection. If the device is currently not connected it will not be reconnected when it becomes available.

Also see: devicestatechange

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params?.type string <sup>(optional)</sup> Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device ERROR_ALREADY_RELEASED Device not connected ERROR_REQUEST_SUBMITTED Device is currently not connected but it's autoconnection mode has been disabled

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.disconnect",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: pair <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Pairs a Bluetooth device.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
PIN-code or passkey requests may appear during the pairing process. The process can be cancelled any time by calling the abortpairing method.

Also see: devicestatechange, pincoderequest, passkeyrequest, passkeyconfirmrequest

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params?.type string <sup>(optional)</sup> Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy) params?.capabilities string <sup>(optional)</sup> Pairing capabilities (must be one of the following: DisplayOnly, DisplayYesNo, KeyboardDisplay, KeyboardOnly, NoInputNoOutput) (default: NoInputNoOutput) params?.timeout integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum time allowed for the pairing process to complete (in seconds) (default: 20)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device ERROR_ALREADY_CONNECTED Device already paired ERROR_GENERAL Failed to pair the device

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.pair",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "LowEnergy",
    "capabilities": "NoInputNoOutput",
    "timeout": 60
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: unpair <sup>method</sup>
docs.text:
Unpairs a paired Bluetooth device.

Also see: devicestatechange

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params?.type string <sup>(optional)</sup> Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device ERROR_ALREADY_RELEASED Device not paired

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.unpair",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: abortpairing <sup>method</sup>
docs.text:
Aborts pairing operation.

Also see: devicestatechange

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params?.type string <sup>(optional)</sup> Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Device not currently pairing

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.abortpairing",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: providepincode <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Provides a PIN-code for authentication during a legacy pairing process.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
This method should be called upon receiving a pincoderequest event during a legacy pairing process. If the specified PIN-code is incorrect the pairing process will be aborted.

Also see: devicestatechange, pincoderequest

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: Classic) params.secret string A PIN-code string typically consisting of (but not limited to) four decimal digits

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Device not currently pairing or PIN code has not been requested

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.providepincode",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Classic",
    "secret": "0000"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: providepasskey <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Provides a passkey for authentication during a pairing process.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
This method should be called upon receiving a passkeyrequest event during pairing process. If the specified passkey is incorrect or empty the pairing process will be aborted.

Also see: devicestatechange, passkeyrequest

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: Classic) params.secret integer A six-digit decimal number passkey

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Device not currently pairing or a passkey has not been requested

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.providepasskey",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Classic",
    "secret": 123456
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: confirmpasskey <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Confirms a passkey for authentication during a pairing process.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
This method should be called upon receiving a passkeyconfirmationrequest event during a pairing process. If the confirmation is negative the pairing process will be aborted.

Also see: devicestatechange, passkeyconfirmrequest

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: Classic) params.iscorrect boolean Specifies if the passkey sent in passkeyconfirmrequest event is correct (true) or incorrect (false)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Device is currently not pairing or passkey confirmation has not been requested

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.confirmpasskey",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Classic",
    "iscorrect": true
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: forget <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Forgets a known Bluetooth device.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The device will no longer be listed and its status tracked. If the device is connected and/or paired it will be disconnected and unpaired.

Also see: devicestatechange

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.forget",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: getdevicelist <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Retrieves a list of known remote Bluetooth devices.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array List of devices result[#] object (device entry) result[#].address string Bluetooth address result[#].type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.getdevicelist"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
      "type": "LowEnergy"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: getdeviceinfo <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Retrieves detailed information about a known Bluetooth device.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result.address string Bluetooth address result.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy) result?.name string <sup>(optional)</sup> Name of the device result?.class integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Class of device result?.appearance integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Appearance value result?.services array <sup>(optional)</sup> List of supported services result?.services[#] string <sup>(optional)</sup> Service UUID result.connected boolean Indicates if the device is currently connected result.paired boolean Indicates if the device is currently paired

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.getdeviceinfo",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Classic",
    "name": "Thunder Bluetooth Speaker",
    "class": 2360324,
    "appearance": 2113,
    "services": [
      "110a"
    ],
    "connected": true,
    "paired": true
  }
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the BluetoothControl plugin:

BluetoothControl interface properties:

Property Description adapters (read-only) List of local Bluetooth adapters adapter (read-only) Local Bluetooth adapter information devices deprecated (read-only) List of known remote Bluetooth devices device deprecated (read-only) Remote Bluetooth device information

docs.title: adapters <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the list of local Bluetooth adapters.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array List of local Bluetooth adapters result[#] integer Adapter ID

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.adapters"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    0
  ]
}

docs.title: adapter <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the local Bluetooth adapter information.

This property is read-only.

The adapter id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. BluetoothControl.1.adapter@<adapter-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description adapter-id string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Local Bluetooth adapter information result.id integer Interface ID number result.interface string Interface name result.address string Bluetooth address result.type string Adapter type (default: Dual) result.version integer Version result?.manufacturer integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Manufacturer company identifer result?.class integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Class of device result?.name string <sup>(optional)</sup> Name result?.shortname string <sup>(optional)</sup> Short name

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown adapter device

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.adapter@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "id": 0,
    "interface": "hci0",
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Dual",
    "version": 8,
    "manufacturer": 15,
    "class": 1060,
    "name": "Thunder Bluetooth Controller",
    "shortname": "Thunder"
  }
}

docs.title: devices <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the list of known remote Bluetooth devices.

This property is read-only.

devices is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array List of known remote Bluetooth devices result[#] string Bluetooth address

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.devices"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE"
  ]
}

docs.title: device <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the remote Bluetooth device information.

This property is read-only.

device is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

The device address argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. BluetoothControl.1.device@<device-address>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description device-address string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Remote Bluetooth device information result.address string Bluetooth address result.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy) result?.name string <sup>(optional)</sup> Name of the device result?.class integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Class of device result?.appearance integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Appearance value result?.services array <sup>(optional)</sup> List of supported services result?.services[#] string <sup>(optional)</sup> Service UUID result.connected boolean Indicates if the device is currently connected result.paired boolean Indicates if the device is currently paired

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown device

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.device@81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Classic",
    "name": "Thunder Bluetooth Speaker",
    "class": 2360324,
    "appearance": 2113,
    "services": [
      "110a"
    ],
    "connected": true,
    "paired": true
  }
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the BluetoothControl plugin:

BluetoothControl interface events:

Notification Description discoverablestarted Notifies of entering the discoverable state discoverablecomplete Notifies of leaving the discoverable state scanstarted Notifies of scan start scancomplete Notifies of scan completion devicestatechange Notifies of device state changes pincoderequest Notifies of a PIN code request passkeyrequest Notifies of a passkey request passkeyconfirmrequest Notifies of a passkey confirmation request

docs.title: discoverablestarted <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of entering the discoverable state.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Register to this event to be notified about entering the discoverable state

If applicable, this notification may be sent out during registration, reflecting the current status.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Discoverable type (default: LowEnergy) params.mode string Discoverable mode (default: General) params?.connectable boolean <sup>(optional)</sup> Indicates connectable advertising (true, LowEnergy only) (default: False)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "discoverablestarted",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.discoverablestarted",
  "params": {
    "type": "LowEnergy",
    "mode": "General",
    "connectable": false
  }
}

docs.title: discoverablecomplete <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of leaving the discoverable state.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about leaving the discoverable state

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Discoverable type (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "discoverablecomplete",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.discoverablecomplete",
  "params": {
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: scanstarted <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of scan start.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Register to this event to be notified about device scan start

If applicable, this notification may be sent out during registration, reflecting the current status.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Scan type (default: LowEnergy) params?.mode string <sup>(optional)</sup> Scan mode (default: General)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "scanstarted",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.scanstarted",
  "params": {
    "type": "LowEnergy",
    "mode": "General"
  }
}

docs.title: scancomplete <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of scan completion.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about device scan completion

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Scan type (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "scancomplete",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.scancomplete",
  "params": {
    "type": "LowEnergy"
  }
}

docs.title: devicestatechange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of device state changes.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Register to this event to be notified about device state changes

If applicable, this notification may be sent out during registration, reflecting the current status.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy) params.state string Device state params?.disconnectreason string (optional) Disconnection reason in case of Disconnected event

The device type argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. LowEnergy.client.devicestatechange.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "devicestatechange",
    "id": "LowEnergy.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "LowEnergy.client.devicestatechange",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "LowEnergy",
    "state": "Disconnected",
    "disconnectreason": "ConnectionTimeout"
  }
}

docs.title: pincoderequest <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of a PIN code request.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about PIN code requests during a legacy pairing process. Upon receiving this event the client is required to respond with a providepincode call in order to complete the pairing procedure. The PIN code value would typically be collected by prompting the end-user. If the client fails to respond before the pairing timeout elapses the pairing procedure will be aborted.Note that this event will never be send for a Bluetooth LowEnergy device

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "pincoderequest",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.pincoderequest",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Classic"
  }
}

docs.title: passkeyrequest <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of a passkey request.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about passkey requests that may be required during a pairing process. Upon receiving this event the client is required to respond with a providepasskey call in order to complete the pairing procedure. The passkey value would typically be collected by prompting the end-user. If the client fails to respond before the pairing timeout elapses the pairing procedure will be aborted

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: LowEnergy)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "passkeyrequest",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.passkeyrequest",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Classic"
  }
}

docs.title: passkeyconfirmrequest <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of a passkey confirmation request.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about passkey confirmation requests that may required during a pairing process. Upon receiving this event the client is required to respond with a passkeyconfirm call in order to complete the pairing procedure. The passkey confirmation would typically be collected by prompting the end-user. If the client fails to respond before the pairing timeout elapses the pairing procedure will be aborted

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address params.type string Device type (must be one of the following: Classic, LowEnergy, LowEnergyRandom) (default: Classic) params.secret integer A six-digit decimal number passkey sent by the remote device for confirmation; may be 0 for a simple accept/forbid paring request

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "passkeyconfirmrequest",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.passkeyconfirmrequest",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE",
    "type": "Classic",
    "secret": 123456
  }
}

docs.title: Bluetooth Remote Control Plugin
docs.text:
Version: 1.0

Status:

BluetoothRemoteControl plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Configuration
  • Interfaces
  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the BluetoothRemoteControl plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Bluetooth Remote Control plugin allows configuring and enabling Bluetooth remote control units.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: BluetoothRemoteControl) classname string Class name: BluetoothRemoteControl locator string Library name: libThunderBluetoothRemoteControl.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.controller string (optional) Controller configuration?.keymap string (optional) Keymap configuration?.keyingest boolean (optional) Enable keyingest configuration?.recorder enum (optional) Recorder

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • BluetoothRemoteControl.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the BluetoothRemoteControl plugin:

BluetoothRemoteControl interface methods:

Method Description assign Assigns a bluetooth device as a remote control unit revoke Revokes the current remote control assignment

docs.title: assign <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Assigns a bluetooth device as a remote control unit.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.address string Bluetooth address

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Bluetooth unavailable ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Device unknown ERROR_GENERAL Failed to assign the device

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.assign",
  "params": {
    "address": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: revoke <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Revokes the current remote control assignment.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Remote not assigned

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.revoke"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the BluetoothRemoteControl plugin:

BluetoothRemoteControl interface properties:

Property Description name (read-only) Unit name address (read-only) Bluetooth address of the unit info (read-only) Unit auxiliary information batterylevel (read-only) Battery level voice Enable or Disable the flow of Voice data fragments from the remote audioprofile (read-only) Audio profile details

docs.title: name <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the unit name.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Name of the remote control unit

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE No remote has been assigned

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.name"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "Acme Bluetooth RCU"
}

docs.title: address <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the bluetooth address of the unit.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Bluetooth address

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE No remote has been assigned

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.address"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "81:6F:B0:91:9B:FE"
}

docs.title: info <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the unit auxiliary information.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Unit auxiliary information result?.model string <sup>(optional)</sup> Unit model name or number result?.serial string <sup>(optional)</sup> Unit serial number result?.firmware string <sup>(optional)</sup> Unit firmware revision result?.software string <sup>(optional)</sup> Unit software revision result?.manufacturer string <sup>(optional)</sup> Unit manufacturer name

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE No remote has been assigned ERROR_GENERAL Failed to retrieve information

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.info"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "model": "Acme 1500 Plus",
    "serial": "1234567890",
    "firmware": "1.0",
    "software": "1.0",
    "manufacturer": "Acme Inc."
  }
}

docs.title: batterylevel <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the battery level.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Remote control unit's battery level in percentage

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE No remote has been assigned ERROR_GENERAL Failed to retrieve battery level

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.batterylevel"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 50
}

docs.title: voice <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the enable or Disable the flow of Voice data fragments from the remote.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) boolean Enable (true) or Disable (false) flow of voice data

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result boolean Enable (true) or Disable (false) flow of voice data

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to set the voice flow

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.voice"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": false
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.voice",
  "params": false
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: audioprofile <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the audio profile details.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Audio profile details result.codec string Name of the audio codec (pcm for uncompressed audio) result.channels integer Number of audio channels (1: mono, 2: stereo, etc.) result.rate integer Sample rate (in Hz) result.resolution integer Sample resolution (in bits per sample)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE No remote has been assigned ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY The supplied audio profile is unknown

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.audioprofile"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "codec": "ADPCM",
    "channels": 1,
    "rate": 16000,
    "resolution": 16
  }
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the BluetoothRemoteControl plugin:

BluetoothRemoteControl interface events:

Notification Description audiotransmission Notifies about audio data transmission audioframe Notifies about new audio data available batterylevelchange Notifies about battery level changes

docs.title: audiotransmission <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies about audio data transmission.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about audio transmission status

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params?.profile string <sup>(optional)</sup> Type of audio profile, marking start of transmission; empty in case of end of transmission

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "audiotransmission",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.audiotransmission",
  "params": {
    "profile": "pcm"
  }
}

docs.title: audioframe <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies about new audio data available.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about audio data

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params?.seq integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Sequence number of the audio frame within current audio transmission params.data string Base64 representation of the binary data of the audio frame; format of the data is specified by the audio profile denoted by the most recent audiotransmission notification

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "audioframe",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.audioframe",
  "params": {
    "seq": 1,
    "data": "yKMHiYh6qJiDspB6S7ihlKOAbivApYEQDCgY0aECCQhpkAqZogP1ECk9GbHGEAkwG8Ax8wArgaAtEMjGQIoYCKKgGCuzBSA/iuWkKEwamLKzOKoCeR2hwQQZKqgBKKqELoGQwQ=="
  }
}

docs.title: batterylevelchange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies about battery level changes.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about battery level drops

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.level integer Battery level (in percentage)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "BluetoothRemoteControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "batterylevelchange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.batterylevelchange",
  "params": {
    "level": 50
  }
}

docs.title: Bluetooth SDP Server Plugin
docs.text:
Version: 1.0

Status:

BluetoothSDPServer plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Configuration

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the BluetoothSDPServer plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON SDP Service Discovery Protocol

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Bluetooth SDP Server runs a service discovery server for Bluetooth devices. The SDP server may be required for some audio source devices and is mandatory for discovery by nearby audio sink devices. .

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: BluetoothSDPServer) classname string Class name: BluetoothSDPServer locator string Library name: libThunderBluetoothSDPServer.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object ... configuration.controller string Callsign of the Bluetooth controller service (typically BluetoothControl) configuration?.provider string (optional) Name of the service provider (e.g. device manufacturer) configuration?.services array (optional) ... configuration?.services[#] object (optional) Service settings configuration?.services[#]?.class string (optional) Class of the Bluetooth service configuration?.services[#].callsign string Callsign of the service providing the functionality configuration?.services[#]?.name string (optional) Name of the service advertised over SDP configuration?.services[#]?.description string (optional) Description of the service advertised over SDP configuration?.services[#]?.public boolean (optional) Indicates if the service is listed in SDP PublicBrowseRoot group configuration?.services[#]?.parameters object (optional) Service-specific configuration parameters

  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Cobalt plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Cobalt plugin provides web browsing functionality based on the Cobalt engine.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: Cobalt) classname string Class name: Cobalt locator string Library name: libThunderCobalt.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.url string (optional) The URL that is loaded upon starting the browser configuration?.width integer (optional) The width in pixels of the surface to be used by the application configuration?.height integer (optional) The height in pixels of the surface to be used by the application configuration?.repeatstart integer (optional) The number of milliseconds a key should be pressed to start reapeating (set max to adhere to Thunder) configuration?.repeatinterval integer (optional) The number of milliseconds the repeated key is send after it started repeating (set max to adhere to Thunder) configuration?.clientidentifier string (optional) An identifier, used during the surface creation as additional information configuration?.operatorname string (optional) The name of the operator that owns the infrastructure on which this device is running configuration?.language string (optional) The language to be used to for user interaction configuration?.connection string (optional) The type of connection that is used for internet connectivity configuration?.playbackrates boolean (optional) If enabled, Cobalt supports different rates, otherwise, it supports only 0 and 1 (default: true)

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • Cobalt.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • Browser.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • StateControl.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Cobalt plugin:

Browser interface methods:

Method Description delete Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage

docs.title: delete <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to recursively delete contents of a directory

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.path string Path to directory (within the persistent storage) to delete contents of

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY The given path was incorrect

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.delete",
  "params": {
    "path": ".cache/wpe/disk-cache"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the Cobalt plugin:

Browser interface properties:

Property Description url URL loaded in the browser visibility Current browser visibility fps (read-only) Current number of frames per second the browser is rendering

StateControl interface properties:

Property Description state Running state of the service

docs.title: url <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the URL loaded in the browser.

Also see: urlchange

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string URL loaded in the browser

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string URL loaded in the browser

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_INCORRECT_URL Incorrect URL given

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.url"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "https://www.google.com"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.url",
  "params": "https://www.google.com"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: visibility <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the current browser visibility.

Also see: visibilitychange

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string Current browser visibility

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Current browser visibility

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Returned when the operation is unavailable

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.visibility"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "visible"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.visibility",
  "params": "visible"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: fps <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the current number of frames per second the browser is rendering.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Current number of frames per second the browser is rendering

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.fps"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 30
}

docs.title: state <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the running state of the service.

Also see: statechange

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string Running state of the service

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Running state of the service

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.state"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "resumed"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.state",
  "params": "resumed"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Cobalt plugin:

Browser interface events:

Notification Description urlchange Signals a URL change in the browser visibilitychange Signals a visibility change of the browser

StateControl interface events:

Notification Description statechange Signals a state change of the service

docs.title: urlchange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a URL change in the browser.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.url string The URL that has been loaded or requested params.loaded boolean Determines if the URL has just been loaded (true) or if URL change has been requested (false) (default: True)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "urlchange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.urlchange",
  "params": {
    "url": "https://www.google.com",
    "loaded": false
  }
}

docs.title: visibilitychange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a visibility change of the browser.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.hidden boolean Determines if the browser has been hidden (true) or made visible (false)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "visibilitychange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.visibilitychange",
  "params": {
    "hidden": false
  }
}

docs.title: statechange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a state change of the service.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.suspended boolean Determines if the service has entered suspended state (true) or resumed state (false)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Cobalt.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "statechange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.statechange",
  "params": {
    "suspended": false
  }
}

Compositor plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Compositor plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, methods and properties provided.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Compositor gives you control over what is displayed on screen.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: Compositor) classname string Class name: Compositor locator string Library name: libThunderCompositor.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.hardwareready integer (optional) Hardware delay (Nexus) configuration?.resolution string (optional) Screen resolution (Nexus) configuration?.allowedclients array (optional) List of allowed clients (Nexus) configuration?.allowedclients[#] string (optional) ... configuration?.connector enum (optional) Resolution (Wayland) configuration?.join boolean (optional) Enable join (Wayland) configuration?.display string (optional) Display (Westeros) configuration?.renderer string (optional) Path of renderer (Westeros) configuration?.glname string (optional) Name of GL-library (Westeros) configuration?.width string (optional) Screen width (Westeros) configuration?.height string (optional) Screen height (Westeros)

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • Compositor.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Compositor plugin:

Compositor interface methods:

Method Description putontop Puts client surface on top in z-order putbelow Puts client surface below another surface select Directs the input to the given client, disabling all the others

docs.title: putontop <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Puts client surface on top in z-order.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to get a client's surface to the top position.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.client string Client name

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Client not found

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.putontop",
  "params": {
    "client": "Netflix"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: putbelow <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Puts client surface below another surface.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to reorder client surfaces in the z-order list.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.client string Client name to change z-order position params.relative string Client to put the other surface below

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Client(s) not found

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.putbelow",
  "params": {
    "client": "Netflix",
    "relative": "WebKitBrowser"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: select <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Directs the input to the given client, disabling all the others.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to direct all inputs to this client. The client that is receiving the inputs prior to this call will nolonger receive it anymore after this call.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.client string Client name

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Client not found

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.select",
  "params": {
    "client": "Netflix"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the Compositor plugin:

Compositor interface properties:

Property Description resolution Screen resolution zorder (read-only) List of compositor clients sorted by z-order brightness Brightness of SDR graphics in HDR display geometry Client surface geometry visiblity (write-only) Client surface visibility opacity (write-only) Client surface opacity

docs.title: resolution <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the screen resolution.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this property to set or retrieve the current resolution of the screen.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string Screen resolution

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Screen resolution

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown resolution ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Set resolution is not supported or failed ERROR_GENERAL Failed to set resolution

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.resolution"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "1080p24"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.resolution",
  "params": "1080p24"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: zorder <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the list of compositor clients sorted by z-order.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this property to retrieve the list of all clients in z-order. Each client has an z-order-value that determines its position with respect to the screen. The ordering is that the top position is closest to the screen, the next z-order-value first behind the top, and so on.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array List of compositor clients sorted by z-order result[#] string Client name

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Failed to get z-order

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.zorder"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "Netflix"
  ]
}

docs.title: brightness <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the brightness of SDR graphics in HDR display.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this property to set or retrieve the brightness of the SDR graphics.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string Brightness of SDR graphics in HDR display

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Brightness of SDR graphics in HDR display

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown brightness ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Set brightness is not supported or failed ERROR_GENERAL Failed to set brightness

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.brightness"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "match_video"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.brightness",
  "params": "match_video"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: geometry <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the client surface geometry.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Use this property to update or retrieve the geometry of a client's surface.

The client argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Compositor.1.geometry@<client>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description client string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Client surface geometry (property).x integer Horizontal coordinate of the surface (property).y integer Vertical coordinate of the surface (property).width integer Surface width (property).height integer Surface height

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Client surface geometry result.x integer Horizontal coordinate of the surface result.y integer Vertical coordinate of the surface result.width integer Surface width result.height integer Surface height

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Client not found

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.geometry@Netflix"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "x": 0,
    "y": 0,
    "width": 1280,
    "height": 720
  }
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.geometry@Netflix",
  "params": {
    "x": 0,
    "y": 0,
    "width": 1280,
    "height": 720
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: visiblity <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the client surface visibility.

This property is write-only.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Use this property to set the client's surface visibility.

The client argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Compositor.1.visiblity@<client>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description client string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string Client surface visibility

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Client not found

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.visiblity@Netflix",
  "params": "visible"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: opacity <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the client surface opacity.

This property is write-only.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Use this property to set the client's surface opacity level.

The client argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Compositor.1.opacity@<client>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description client string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) integer Opacity level (0 to 255; 0: fully transparent, 255: fully opaque)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Client not found

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Compositor.1.opacity@Netflix",
  "params": 127
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: References

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Containers plugin provides informations about process containers running on system.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: Containers) classname string Class name: Containers locator string Library name: libWPEContainers.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • Containers.json (version 1.0.0) (compliant format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Containers plugin:

Containers interface methods:

Method Description start Starts a new container stop Stops a container

docs.title: start <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Starts a new container.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params?.name string <sup>(optional)</sup> Name of container params?.command string <sup>(optional)</sup> Command that will be started in the container params?.parameters array <sup>(optional)</sup> List of parameters supplied to command params?.parameters[#] string <sup>(optional)</sup> ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors

The name argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Containers.1.memory@<name>.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: DHCPServer) classname string Class name: DHCPServer locator string Library name: libThunderDHCPServer.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object Server configuration configuration.name string Name of the server configuration.servers array List of configured DHCP servers configuration.servers[#] object Configuration of a server configuration.servers[#].interface string Name of the network interface to bind to configuration.servers[#].poolstart integer IP pool start number configuration.servers[#].poolsize integer IP pool size (in IP numbers) configuration.servers[#]?.router integer (optional) IP of router
