docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the NetworkControl plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Network Control plugin provides functionality for network interface management.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: NetworkControl) classname string Class name: NetworkControl locator string Library name: libThunderNetworkControl.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.dnsfile string (optional) Path to DNS resolve file (default: /etc/resolv.conf) configuration?.response integer (optional) Maximum response time out of the DHCP server configuration?.retries integer (optional) Maximum number of retries to the DHCP server

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • INetworkControl (INetworkControl.h) (version 1.0.0) (compliant format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the NetworkControl plugin:

NetworkControl interface methods:

Method Description flush Flush and reload requested interface

docs.title: flush <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Flush and reload requested interface.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.interface string Name of the interface to be flushed

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.flush",
  "params": {
    "interface": "..."
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the NetworkControl plugin:

NetworkControl interface properties:

Property Description interfaces (read-only) Currently available interfaces status (read-only) Status of requested interface network Network info of requested interface dns DNS list up Provides given requested interface is up or not

docs.title: interfaces <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the currently available interfaces.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Currently available interfaces result[#] string ...

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.interfaces"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "..."
  ]
}

docs.title: status <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the status of requested interface.

This property is read-only.

The interface argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. NetworkControl.1.status@<interface>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description interface string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Status of requested interface (must be one of the following: Available, Unavailable)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.status@xyz"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "Unavailable"
}

docs.title: network <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the network info of requested interface.

The interface argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. NetworkControl.1.network@<interface>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description interface string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Network info of requested interface (property).value array ... (property).value[#] object ... (property).value[#].address string IP Address (property).value[#].defaultgateway string Default Gateway (property).value[#].mask integer Network mask (property).value[#].mode string Mode of interface activation Dynamic or Static (must be one of the following: Dynamic, Static)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Info about requested interface result[#] object ... result[#].address string IP Address result[#].defaultgateway string Default Gateway result[#].mask integer Network mask result[#].mode string Mode of interface activation Dynamic or Static (must be one of the following: Dynamic, Static)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Failed to set/retrieve network

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.network@xyz"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "address": "...",
      "defaultgateway": "...",
      "mask": 0,
      "mode": "Static"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.network@xyz",
  "params": {
    "value": [
      {
        "address": "...",
        "defaultgateway": "...",
        "mask": 0,
        "mode": "Static"
      }
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: dns <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the DNS list.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object DNS list (property).value array ... (property).value[#] string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array List of DNS result[#] string ...

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Failed to set/retrieve DNS

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.dns"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "..."
  ]
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.dns",
  "params": {
    "value": [
      "..."
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: up <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the provides given requested interface is up or not.

The interface argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. NetworkControl.1.up@<interface>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description interface string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Provides given requested interface is up or not (property).value boolean ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result boolean Up/Down requested interface

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Failed to set/retrieve UP

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.up@xyz"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": false
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.up@xyz",
  "params": {
    "value": false
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the NetworkControl plugin:

NetworkControl interface events:

Notification Description update Signal interface update

docs.title: update <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signal interface update.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.interfacename string Name of the interface where an update occured

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "NetworkControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "update",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.update",
  "params": {
    "interfacename": "..."
  }

OCDM plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the OCDM plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, properties provided and notifications sent.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: OCDM) classname string Class name: OCDM locator string Library name: libThunderOCDM.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.location string (optional) Location configuration?.connector string (optional) Connector configuration?.sharepath string (optional) Sharepath configuration?.sharesize string (optional) Sharesize configuration?.systems array (optional) List of key systems configuration?.systems[#] object (optional) System properties configuration?.systems[#]?.name string (optional) Name configuration?.systems[#]?.designators array (optional) ... configuration?.systems[#]?.designators[#] object (optional) Designator configuration?.systems[#]?.designators[#].name string ...

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • OCDM.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the OCDM plugin:

OCDM interface properties:

Property Description drms (read-only) Supported DRM systems keysystems (read-only) DRM key systems sessions (read-only) Active sessions enumerator

docs.title: drms <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the supported DRM systems.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Supported DRM systems result[#] object ... result[#].name string Name of the DRM result[#].keysystems array Key system identifier list result[#].keysystems[#] string Identifier of a key system

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.drms"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "name": "PlayReady",
      "keysystems": [
        "com.microsoft.playready"
      ]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: keysystems <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the DRM key systems.

This property is read-only.

The drm system argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. OCDM.1.keysystems@<drm-system>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description drm-system string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array DRM key systems result[#] string Identifier of a key system

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Invalid DRM name

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.keysystems@PlayReady"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "com.microsoft.playready"
  ]
}

docs.title: sessions <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the active sessions enumerator.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Active sessions enumerator result[#] object ... result[#].drm string Name of the DRM system

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.sessions"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    {
      "drm": "PlayReady"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the OCDM plugin:

OCDM interface events:

Notification Description drmalreadyinitialized Signals that the specified DRM system could not be initialized because it is already initialized by another process drminitializationstatus Notifies about DRM initialization status

docs.title: drmalreadyinitialized <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals that the specified DRM system could not be initialized because it is already initialized by another process.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When this event is received, the application owning given DRM system should release it immediately.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.drm string Name of the DRM system

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "drmalreadyinitialized",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.drmalreadyinitialized",
  "params": {
    "drm": "PlayReady"
  }
}

docs.title: drminitializationstatus <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies about DRM initialization status.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Register to this event to be notified about DRM retrying status busy/failure/success

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.status string BUSY - drm is used by another process, SUCCESS - recovered from BUSY state after retry, FAILED - not recovered after re-trying from BUSY params.drm string Name of the DRM system

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "OCDM.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "drminitializationstatus",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.drminitializationstatus",
  "params": {
    "status": "SUCCESS",
    "drm": "PlayReady"
  }
}

docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Packager plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration and methods provided.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Packager plugin allows installation of OPKG, IPKG and DEB packages to the system from a remote repository.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: Packager) classname string Class name: Packager locator string Library name: libThunderPackager.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • Packager.json (version 1.0.0) (compliant format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Packager plugin:

Packager interface methods:

Method Description install Installs a package given by a name, an URL or a file path synchronize Synchronizes repository manifest with a repository

docs.title: install <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Installs a package given by a name, an URL or a file path.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.package string A name, an URL or a file path of the package to install params?.version string <sup>(optional)</sup> Version of the package to install params?.architecture string <sup>(optional)</sup> Architecture of the package to install

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_INPROGRESS Returned when the function is called while other installation/synchronization is already in progress.

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Packager.1.install",
  "params": {
    "package": "thunder-plugin-netflix",
    "version": "1.0",
    "architecture": "arm"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: synchronize <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Synchronizes repository manifest with a repository.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_INPROGRESS Returned when the function is called while other installation/synchronization is already in progress.

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Packager.1.synchronize"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Retrieve the performance measurement against given package size.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: PerformanceMonitor) classname string Class name: PerformanceMonitor locator string Library name: libThunderPerformanceMonitor.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework

  • PerformanceMonitor.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-collapsed format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the PerformanceMonitor plugin:

PerformanceMonitor interface methods:

Method Description clear Clear all performance data collected send Interface to test send data receive Interface to test receive data exchange Interface to test exchange data

docs.title: clear <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Clear all performance data collected.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PerformanceMonitor.1.clear"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: send <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Interface to test send data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params?.data string <sup>(optional)</sup> Any string data upto the size specified in the length params?.length integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Size of the data params?.duration integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Duration of the measurements

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Size of data received by the jsonrpc interface

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PerformanceMonitor.1.send",
  "params": {
    "data": "abababababab",
    "length": 0,
    "duration": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: receive <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Interface to test receive data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params integer Size of data to be provided by the jsonrpc interface

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result?.data string <sup>(optional)</sup> Any string data upto the size specified in the length result?.length integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Size of the data result?.duration integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Duration of the measurements

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PerformanceMonitor.1.receive",
  "params": 0
}

docs.title: Response

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "data": "abababababab",
    "length": 0,
    "duration": 0
  }
}

docs.title: exchange <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Interface to test exchange data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params?.data string <sup>(optional)</sup> Any string data upto the size specified in the length params?.length integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Size of the data params?.duration integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Duration of the measurements

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result?.data string <sup>(optional)</sup> Any string data upto the size specified in the length result?.length integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Size of the data result?.duration integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Duration of the measurements

{

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the PerformanceMonitor plugin:

PerformanceMonitor interface properties:

Property Description measurement (read-only) Retrieve the performance measurement against given package size

docs.title: measurement <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the retrieve the performance measurement against given package size. Measurements will be provided in milliseconds.

This property is read-only.

The package size argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. PerformanceMonitor.1.measurement@<package-size>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description package-size string Size of package whose statistics info has to be retrieved

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Retrieve the performance measurement against given package size. Measurements will be provided in milliseconds (property).serialization object Time taken to complete serialization (property).serialization?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).serialization?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).serialization?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).serialization?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).deserialization object Time taken to complete deserialization (property).deserialization?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).deserialization?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).deserialization?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).deserialization?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).execution object Time taken to complete execution (property).execution?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).execution?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).execution?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).execution?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).threadpool object Time taken to complete threadpool wait (property).threadpool?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).threadpool?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).threadpool?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).threadpool?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).communication object Time taken to complete communication (property).communication?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).communication?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).communication?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).communication?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected (property).total object Time taken to complete whole jsonrpc process (property).total?.minimum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Minimum value of measurements (property).total?.maximum integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Maximum value of measurements (property).total?.average integer <sup>(optional)</sup> Average value of measurements (property).total?.count integer <sup>(optional)</sup> How many times measurement has been collected

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PerformanceMonitor.1.measurement@1000"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the PlayerInfo plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, properties provided and notifications sent.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The PlayerInfo plugin helps to get system supported Audio Video codecs.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: PlayerInfo) classname string Class name: PlayerInfo locator string Library name: libWPEPlayerInfo.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • IPlayerProperties (IPlayerInfo.h) (version 1.0.0) (compliant format)
  • Dolby::IOutput (IDolby.h) (version 1.0.0) (compliant format)

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the PlayerInfo plugin:

PlayerProperties interface properties:

Property Description audiocodecs (read-only) Query Audio Codecs List videocodecs (read-only) Query Video Codecs List resolution (read-only) Current Video playback resolution isaudioequivalenceenabled (read-only) Checks Loudness Equivalence in platform

Dolby Output interface properties:

Property Description dolbyatmossupported / dolby_atmosmetadata (read-only) Atmos capabilities of Sink dolbysoundmode / dolby_soundmode (read-only) Sound Mode - Mono/Stereo/Surround dolbyatmosoutput / dolby_enableatmosoutput (write-only) Enable Atmos Audio Output dolbymode / dolby_mode Dolby Mode

docs.title: audiocodecs <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the query Audio Codecs List.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Query Audio Codecs List result[#] string ... (must be one of the following: AudioAac, AudioAc3, AudioAc3Plus, AudioDts, AudioMpeg1, AudioMpeg2, AudioMpeg3, AudioMpeg4, AudioOpus, AudioUndefined, AudioVorbisOgg, AudioWav)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.audiocodecs"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "AudioUndefined"
  ]
}

docs.title: videocodecs <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the query Video Codecs List.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Query Video Codecs List result[#] string ... (must be one of the following: VideoH263, VideoH264, VideoH265, VideoH26510, VideoMpeg, VideoMpeg2, VideoMpeg4, VideoUndefined, VideoVp10, VideoVp8, VideoVp9)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.videocodecs"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": [
    "VideoUndefined"
  ]
}

docs.title: resolution <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the current Video playback resolution.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Current Video playback resolution (must be one of the following: Resolution1080I, Resolution1080I24, Resolution1080I25, Resolution1080I30, Resolution1080I50, Resolution1080P, Resolution1080P24, Resolution1080P25, Resolution1080P30, Resolution1080P50, Resolution2160P, Resolution2160P24, Resolution2160P25, Resolution2160P30, Resolution2160P50, Resolution2160P60, Resolution480I, Resolution480I24, Resolution480I25, Resolution480I30, Resolution480I50, Resolution480P, Resolution480P24, Resolution480P25, Resolution480P30, Resolution480P50, Resolution576I, Resolution576I24, Resolution576I25, Resolution576I30, Resolution576I50, Resolution576P, Resolution576P24, Resolution576P25, Resolution576P30, Resolution576P50, Resolution720P, Resolution720P24, Resolution720P25, Resolution720P30, Resolution720P50, ResolutionUnknown)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.resolution"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "ResolutionUnknown"
}

docs.title: isaudioequivalenceenabled <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the checks Loudness Equivalence in platform.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result boolean Checks Loudness Equivalence in platform

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.isaudioequivalenceenabled"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": false
}

docs.title: dolbyatmossupported <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the atmos capabilities of Sink.

This property is read-only.

dolby_atmosmetadata is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result boolean Atmos capabilities of Sink

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.dolbyatmossupported"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": false
}

docs.title: dolbysoundmode <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the sound Mode - Mono/Stereo/Surround.

This property is read-only.

dolby_soundmode is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Sound Mode - Mono/Stereo/Surround (must be one of the following: Dolbydigital, Dolbydigitalplus, Mono, Passthru, SoundmodeAuto, Stereo, Surround, Unknown)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.dolbysoundmode"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "Unknown"
}

docs.title: dolbyatmosoutput <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the enable Atmos Audio Output.

This property is write-only.

dolby_enableatmosoutput is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) boolean Enable/Disable

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.dolbyatmosoutput",
  "params": false
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: dolbymode <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the dolby Mode.

dolby_mode is an alternative name for this property. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string Dolby mode type (must be one of the following: Auto, DigitalAc3, DigitalPassthrough, DigitalPcm, DigitalPlus, Ms12)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string Dolby mode type (must be one of the following: Auto, DigitalAc3, DigitalPassthrough, DigitalPcm, DigitalPlus, Ms12)

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.dolbymode"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": "DigitalPcm"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.dolbymode",
  "params": "DigitalPcm"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the PlayerInfo plugin:

Dolby Output interface events:

Notification Description soundmodechanged / dolby_audiomodechanged Signal audio mode change

docs.title: soundmodechanged <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text:
Signal audio mode change.

dolby_audiomodechanged is an alternative name for this notification. This name is deprecated and may be removed in the future. It is not recommended for use in new implementations.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.mode string Changed Mode (must be one of the following: Dolbydigital, Dolbydigitalplus, Mono, Passthru, SoundmodeAuto, Stereo, Surround, Unknown) params.enabled boolean Enabled/Disabled

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "PlayerInfo.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "soundmodechanged",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.soundmodechanged",
  "params": {
    "mode": "Unknown",
    "enabled": false
  }
}

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: Power) classname string Class name: Power locator string Library name: libThunderPower.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.powerkey integer (optional) Key associated as powerkey configuration?.offmode string (optional) Type of offmode configuration?.control boolean (optional) Enable control clients configuration?.gpiopin integer (optional) GGIO pin (Broadcom) configuration?.gpiotype sting (optional) GPIO type (Broadcom) configuration?.statechange integer (optional) Statechange (Broadcom)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Power plugin:

Power interface methods:

Method Description set Sets power state

docs.title: set <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Sets power state.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.powerstate string Power state params.timeout integer Time to wait for power state change

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL General failure ERROR_DUPLICATE_KEY Trying to set the same power mode ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Power state is not supported ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Invalid Power state or Bad JSON param data format

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Power.1.set",
  "params": {
    "powerstate": "on",
    "timeout": 0

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The RemoteControl plugin provides user-input functionality from various key-code sources (e.g. STB RC).

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: RemoteControl) classname string Class name: RemoteControl locator string Library name: libThunderRemoteControl.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.mapfile string (optional) Map File configuration?.postlookupfile string (optional) PostLookup File configuration?.passon boolean (optional) Enable passon configuration?.repeatstart integer (optional) Maximum number of repeats configuration?.repeatinterval integer (optional) Maximum duration between repeats configuration?.releasetimeout integer (optional) Release timeout configuration?.devices array (optional) List of devices configuration?.devices[#] object (optional) ... configuration?.devices[#]?.name string (optional) Name configuration?.devices[#]?.mapfile string (optional) Map File configuration?.devices[#]?.passon boolean (optional) Enable passon configuration?.devices[#]?.settings string (optional) Settings configuration?.virtuals array (optional) List of virtuals configuration?.virtuals[#] object (optional) ... configuration?.virtuals[#]?.name string (optional) Name configuration?.virtuals[#]?.mapfile string (optional) Map File configuration?.virtuals[#]?.passon boolean (optional) Enable passon configuration?.virtuals[#]?.settings string (optional) Settings configuration?.links array (optional) List of Links configuration?.links[#] object (optional) ... configuration?.links[#]?.name string (optional) Name configuration?.links[#]?.mapfile string (optional) Map File

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the RemoteControl plugin:

RemoteControl interface methods:

Method Description key Gets key code details send Sends a key to a device (press and release) press Presses a key on a device release Releases a key on a device add Adds a key code to the key map modify Modifies a key code in the key map delete Deletes a key code from the key map load Re-loads the device's key map from persistent memory save Saves the device's key map into persistent path pair Activates pairing mode of a device unpair Unpairs a device

docs.text: Gets key code details.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.device string Device name params.code integer Key code

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object ... result.code integer Key code result.key integer Key ingest value result?.modifiers array <sup>(optional)</sup> List of key modifiers result?.modifiers[#] string <sup>(optional)</sup> Key modifier

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Key does not exist ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Unknown device ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Bad JSON param data format

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "RemoteControl.1.key",
  "params": {
    "device": "DevInput",
    "code": 1
  }
}

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "code": 1,

  }
}

    "Web"
  ]

docs.title: device <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the metadata of a specific device.

This property is read-only.

The device argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. RemoteControl.1.device@<device>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description device string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Metadata of a specific device result.metadata string Device metadata

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_GENERAL Metadata not supported on a virtual device ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Unknown device ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Bad JSON param data format

docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "RemoteControl.1.device@DevInput"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "metadata": "It is based on protocol A"
  }
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the RemoteControl plugin:

RemoteControl interface events:

Notification Description keypressed Notifies of a key press/release action

docs.title: keypressed <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of a key press/release action.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.pressed boolean Denotes if the key was pressed (true) or released (false)

The key code argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 42.client.keypressed.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "RemoteControl.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "keypressed",
    "id": "42.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "42.client.keypressed",
  "params": {
    "pressed": false
  }
}

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: Spark) classname string Class name: Spark locator string Library name: libThunderSpark.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.url string (optional) The URL that is loaded upon starting the browser

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • Spark.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • Browser.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • StateControl.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Spark plugin:

Browser interface methods:

Method Description delete Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage

docs.title: delete <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to recursively delete contents of a directory

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.path string Path to directory (within the persistent storage) to delete contents of

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY The given path was incorrect

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.delete",
  "params": {
    "path": ".cache/wpe/disk-cache"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the Spark plugin:

Browser interface properties:

Property Description url URL loaded in the browser visibility Current browser visibility fps (read-only) Current number of frames per second the browser is rendering

StateControl interface properties:

Property Description state Running state of the service

Also see: urlchange

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Spark plugin:

Browser interface events:

Notification Description urlchange Signals a URL change in the browser visibilitychange Signals a visibility change of the browser

StateControl interface events:

Notification Description statechange Signals a state change of the service

docs.title: urlchange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a URL change in the browser.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.url string The URL that has been loaded or requested params.loaded boolean Determines if the URL has just been loaded (true) or if URL change has been requested (false) (default: True)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "urlchange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.urlchange",
  "params": {
    "url": "https://www.google.com",
    "loaded": false
  }
}

docs.title: visibilitychange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a visibility change of the browser.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.hidden boolean Determines if the browser has been hidden (true) or made visible (false)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "visibilitychange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.visibilitychange",
  "params": {
    "hidden": false
  }
}

docs.title: statechange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Signals a state change of the service.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.suspended boolean Determines if the service has entered suspended state (true) or resumed state (false)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Spark.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "statechange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.statechange",
  "params": {
    "suspended": false
  }
}

docs.title: Streamer Plugin
docs.text:
Version: 1.0

Status:

Streamer plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Configuration
  • Interfaces
  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Notifications

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the Streamer plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration, methods and properties as well as sent notifications.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: Streamer) classname string Class name: Streamer locator string Library name: libThunderStreamer.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • Streamer.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the Streamer plugin:

Streamer interface methods:

Method Description create Creates a stream instance destroy Destroys a stream instance load Loads a source into a stream attach Attaches a decoder to the streamer detach Detaches a decoder from the streamer

docs.title: create <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Creates a stream instance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.type string Stream type

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Stream ID

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST Invalid stream type given ERROR_UNAVAILABLE Fronted of the selected stream type is not available

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.create",
  "params": {
    "type": "cable"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 0
}

docs.title: destroy <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Destroys a stream instance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Stream ID

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.destroy",
  "params": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: load <sup>method</sup>
docs.text:
Loads a source into a stream.

Also see: statechange

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Stream ID params.location string Location of the source to load

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_INCORRECT_URL Invalid location given ERROR_GENERAL Undefined loading error ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Stream is not in a valid state

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.load",
  "params": {
    "id": 0,
    "location": "http://example.com/sample.m3u8"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: attach <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Attaches a decoder to the streamer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Stream ID

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_INPROGRESS Decoder already attached ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Stream is not in a valid state ERROR_UNAVAILABLE No free decoders available

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.attach",
  "params": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: detach <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Detaches a decoder from the streamer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.id integer Stream ID

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Stream is not in a valid state or decoder not attached ERROR_INPROGRESS Decoder is in use

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.detach",
  "params": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the Streamer plugin:

Streamer interface properties:

Property Description speed Playback speed position Stream position window Stream playback window speeds (read-only) Speeds supported by the stream player streams (read-only) All created stream instance IDs type (read-only) Type of a stream drm (read-only) DRM type associated with a stream state (read-only) Current state of a stream metadata (read-only) Metadata associated with the stream error (read-only) Most recent error code elements (read-only) Stream elements

docs.title: speed <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the playback speed.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Speed (in percentage)

Also see: statechange

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.speed@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) integer Speed percentage; e.g.: 0 - pause, 100 - normal playback, -100 - rewind, -200 - reverse at twice the normal speed, 50 - forward at half speed, etc. Must be one of the speeds supported by the player

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Speed percentage; e.g.: 0 - pause, 100 - normal playback, -100 - rewind, -200 - reverse at twice the normal speed, 50 - forward at half speed, etc. Must be one of the speeds supported by the player

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Player is not in a valid state or decoder not attached

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.speed@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 100
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.speed@0",
  "params": 100
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: position <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the stream position.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.position@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) integer Position (in milliseconds)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result integer Position (in milliseconds)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Player is not in a valid state or decoder not attached

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:

  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.position@0"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:

  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": 60000

docs.title: Set Request

docs.text:

docs.title: window <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the stream playback window.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.window@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) object Geometry of the window (property).x integer Horizontal position of the window (in pixels) (property).y integer Vertical position of the window (in pixels) (property).width integer Width of the window (in pixels) (property).height integer Height of the window (in pixels)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Geometry of the window result.x integer Horizontal position of the window (in pixels) result.y integer Vertical position of the window (in pixels) result.width integer Width of the window (in pixels) result.height integer Height of the window (in pixels)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Player is not in a valid state or decoder not attached

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "x": 0,
    "y": 0,
    "width": 1080,
    "height": 720
  }
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.window@0",
  "params": {
    "x": 0,
    "y": 0,
    "width": 1080,
    "height": 720
  }
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: speeds <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the speeds supported by the stream player.

This property is read-only.

The stream id argument shall be passed as the index to the property, e.g. Streamer.1.speeds@<stream-id>.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Name Type Description stream-id string ...

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result array Supported speeds (in percentage) result[#] integer (speeds in percentage)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY Unknown stream ID given ERROR_ILLEGAL_STATE Player is not in a valid state or decoder not attached

docs.title: Get Request

  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.speeds@0"

    0,

    2,

docs.title: Get Request

Provides access to the current state of a stream.

Also see: statechange

docs.title: Get Request

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the Streamer plugin:

Streamer interface events:

Notification Description statechange Notifies of stream state change timeupdate Notifies of stream position change stream Notifies of a custom stream incident player Notifies of a custom player incident drm Notifies of a custom DRM-related incident

docs.title: statechange <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of stream state change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.state string Stream state

The Stream ID argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 0.client.statechange.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{

docs.title: timeupdate <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Notifies of stream position change. This event is fired every second to indicate the current stream position. It does not fire if the stream is paused (i.e. speed is set to 0).

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Name Type Description params object ... params.time integer Stream position in miliseconds

The Stream ID argument will be passed within the designator, e.g. 0.client.timeupdate.

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "Streamer.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "timeupdate",
    "id": "0.client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "0.client.timeupdate",
  "params": {
    "time": 30000
  }
}

docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Time Sync plugin provides time synchronization functionality from various time sources (e.g. NTP).

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: TimeSync) classname string Class name: TimeSync locator string Library name: libThunderTimeSync.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework deferred boolean (deprecated) (optional) Determines if automatic time sync shall be initially disabled. This parameter is deprecated and SubSystemControl could be used instead periodicity integer (optional) Periodicity of time synchronization (in hours), 0 for one-off synchronization retries integer (optional) Number of synchronization attempts if the source cannot be reached (may be 0) interval integer (optional) Time to wait (in milliseconds) before retrying a synchronization attempt after a failure sources array Time sources sources[#] string (a time source entry)

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • TimeSync.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)

docs.title: Methods
docs.text:
The following methods are provided by the TimeSync plugin:

TimeSync interface methods:

Method Description synchronize Synchronizes time

docs.title: synchronize <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Synchronizes time.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to synchronize the system time with the currently configured time source. If automatic time synchronization is initially disabled or stopped, it will be restarted.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method takes no parameters.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_INPROGRESS Returned when the method is called while previously triggered synchronization is in progress. ERROR_INCOMPLETE_CONFIG Returned when the source configuration is missing or invalid.

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.synchronize"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the TimeSync plugin:

TimeSync interface properties:

Property Description synctime (read-only) Most recent synchronized time time Current system time

docs.title: synctime <sup>property</sup>
docs.text:
Provides access to the most recent synchronized time.

This property is read-only.

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result object Most recent synchronized time result.time string Synchronized time (in ISO8601 format); empty string if the time has never been synchronized result?.source string <sup>(optional)</sup> The synchronization source e.g. an NTP server

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.synctime"
}

docs.title: Get Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": {
    "time": "2019-05-07T07:20:26Z",
    "source": "ntp://example.com"
  }
}

docs.title: time <sup>property</sup>
docs.text: Provides access to the current system time.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Upon setting this property automatic time synchronization will be stopped. Usage of this property is deprecated and the SubSystem control plugin can be used as an alternative to achieve the same

docs.title: Value
docs.text: Name Type Description (property) string System time (in ISO8601 format)

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result string System time (in ISO8601 format)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_BAD_REQUEST The time is invalid

docs.title: Get Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.time"
}

docs.title: Set Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.time",
  "params": "2019-05-07T07:20:26Z"
}

docs.title: Set Response
docs.text:
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 42,
    "result": "null"
}

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the TimeSync plugin:

TimeSync interface events:

Notification Description timechange Signals a time change

docs.text: Signals a time change.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This notification carries no parameters.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "TimeSync.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "timechange",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.timechange"
}

docs.title: Scope

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The WebKitBrowser plugin provides web browsing functionality based on the WebKit engine.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: WebKitBrowser) classname string Class name: WebKitBrowser locator string Library name: libThunderWebKitBrowser.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.useragent string (optional) The UserAgent used during communication with the web server configuration?.url string (optional) The URL that is loaded upon starting the browser configuration?.injectedbundle string (optional) The name of the .so loaded to extend the HTML5 with customized JavaScript handlers configuration?.cookiestorage string (optional) Post-fixed path to the persistent location on where cookies will be stored configuration?.localstorage string (optional) Post-fixed path to the persistent location on where local-storage will be stored configuration?.certificatecheck boolean (optional) If enabled, SSL certificate error will lead to a page error configuration?.javascript object (optional) ... configuration?.javascript?.useLLInt boolean (optional) Enable Low Level Interpreter configuration?.javascript?.useJIT boolean (optional) Enable JIT configuration?.javascript?.useDFG boolean (optional) Enable Data-Flow-Graph-JIT compiler configuration?.javascript?.useFTL boolean (optional) Enable Faster-Than-Light-JIT compiler configuration?.javascript?.useDOM boolean (optional) Enable the DOM-JIT compiler configuration?.javascript?.dumpOptions string (optional) Dump options: 0 = None, 1 = Overridden only, 2 = All, 3 = Verbose configuration?.secure boolean (optional) If false, every domain can access any other domain, otherwise fill in fields in whitelist definition table configuration?.whitelist object (optional) ... configuration?.whitelist?.origin string (optional) Origin domain allowed to access domains in domain configuration?.whitelist?.domain array (optional) ... configuration?.whitelist?.domain[#] string (optional) Domain allowed to access from origin configuration?.whitelist?.subdomain string (optional) Whether it is also OK to access subdomains of domains listed in domain configuration?.localstorageenabled boolean (optional) Controls the local storage availability configuration?.logtosystemconsoleenabled boolean (optional) Enable page logging to system console (stderr) configuration?.watchdogchecktimeoutinseconds integer (optional) How often to check main event loop for responsiveness (0 - disable) configuration?.watchdoghangthresholdtinseconds integer (optional) The amount of time to give a process to recover before declaring a hang state configuration?.loadblankpageonsuspendenabled boolean (optional) Load 'about:blank' before suspending the page

docs.title: Interfaces
docs.text:
This plugin implements the following interfaces:

  • IWebBrowser (IBrowser.h) (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • IBrowserResources (IBrowser.h) (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • IBrowserSecurity (IBrowser.h) (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • IBrowserScripting (IBrowser.h) (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • IBrowserCookieJar (IBrowser.h) (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-extended format)
  • WebKitBrowser.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-collapsed format)
  • StateControl.json (version 1.0.0) (uncompliant-collapsed format)

The following methods are provided by the WebKitBrowser plugin:

BrowserScripting interface methods:

Method Description runjavascript Run javascript in main frame adduserscript Add user script to be executed at document start removealluserscripts Remove all user scripts

docs.title: delete <sup>method</sup>
docs.text: Removes contents of a directory from the persistent storage.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use this method to recursively delete contents of a directory

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.path string Path to directory (within the persistent storage) to delete contents of

docs.title: Result
docs.text: Name Type Description result null Always null (default: None)

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: Message Description ERROR_UNKNOWN_KEY The given path was incorrect

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WebKitBrowser.1.delete",
  "params": {
    "path": ".cache/wpe/disk-cache"
  }
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "result": null
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
The following properties are provided by the WebKitBrowser plugin:

WebBrowser interface properties:

Property Description url Page loaded in the browser visibility Browser window visibility state fps (read-only) Current framerate the browser is rendering at useragent UserAgent string used by the browser localstorageenabled Controls the local storage availability httpcookieacceptpolicy HTTP cookies accept policy bridgereply (write-only) Response for legacy $badger bridgeevent (write-only) Send legacy $badger event

BrowserResources interface properties:

Property Description userscripts User scripts used by the browser userstylesheets User style sheets used by the browser

BrowserSecurity interface properties:

Property Description securityprofile Security profile for secure connections mixedcontentpolicy Mixed content policy

BrowserCookieJar interface properties:

Property Description cookiejar Get/Set CookieJar config details

WebKitBrowser interface properties:

Property Description languages User preferred languages headers Headers to send on all requests that the browser makes

StateControl interface properties:

Property Description state Running state of the service

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Notifications are autonomous events triggered by the internals of the implementation and broadcasted via JSON-RPC to all registered observers. Refer to [Thunder] for information on how to register for a notification.

The following events are provided by the WebKitBrowser plugin:

WebBrowser interface events:

Notification Description loadfinished Initial HTML document has been completely loaded and parsed loadfailed Browser failed to load page urlchange Signals a URL change in the browser visibilitychange Signals a visibility change of the browser pageclosure Notifies that the web page requests to close its window

BrowserCookieJar interface events:

Notification Description cookiejarchanged Notifies that cookies were added, removed or modified

WebKitBrowser interface events:

Notification Description bridgequery obsolete A Base64 encoded JSON message from legacy $badger bridge

StateControl interface events:

Notification Description statechange Signals a state change of the service

docs.title: loadfinished <sup>notification</sup>
docs.text: Initial HTML document has been completely loaded and parsed.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description params object ... params.url string The URL that has been loaded params.httpstatus integer The response code of main resource request

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 42,
  "method": "WebKitBrowser.1.register",
  "params": {
    "event": "loadfinished",
    "id": "client"
  }
}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.loadfinished",
  "params": {
    "url": "https://example.com",
    "httpstatus": 200
  }
}

}

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "client.loadfailed",
  "params": {
    "url": "https://example.com"
  }
}

docs.title: WebPA Plugin
docs.text:
Version: 1.0

Status:

WebPA plugin for Thunder framework.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Description
  • Configuration

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This document describes purpose and functionality of the WebPA plugin. It includes detailed specification about its configuration.

docs.title: Case Sensitivity
docs.text: All identifiers of the interfaces described in this document are case-sensitive. Thus, unless stated otherwise, all keywords, entities, properties, relations and actions should be treated as such.

docs.title: Acronyms, Abbreviations and Terms
docs.text:
The table below provides and overview of acronyms used in this document and their definitions.

Acronym Description API Application Programming Interface HTTP Hypertext Transfer Protocol JSON JavaScript Object Notation; a data interchange format JSON-RPC A remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON

The table below provides and overview of terms and abbreviations used in this document and their definitions.

Term Description callsign The name given to an instance of a plugin. One plugin can be instantiated multiple times, but each instance the instance name, callsign, must be unique.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Ref ID Description HTTP HTTP specification JSON-RPC JSON-RPC 2.0 specification JSON JSON specification Thunder Thunder API Reference

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The WebPA plugin provides web browsing functionality based on the WebPA engine.

The plugin is designed to be loaded and executed within the Thunder framework. For more information about the framework refer to [Thunder].

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The table below lists configuration options of the plugin.

Name Type Description callsign string Plugin instance name (default: WebPA) classname string Class name: WebPA locator string Library name: libThunderWebPA.so startmode string Determines in which state the plugin should be moved to at startup of the framework configuration object (optional) ... configuration?.interface string (optional) Interface configuration?.pingwaittime string (optional) Ping waittime timout configuration?.webpaurl string (optional) WebPA url configuration?.paroduslocalurl string (optional) Parodus local url configuration?.partnerid string (optional) Partner id configuration?.webpabackoffmax string (optional) WebPA backoff max configuration?.sslcertpath string (optional) Path of SSL certification configuration?.forceipv4 string (optional) Force IPv4 configuration?.location string (optional) Location
